* [H104] Files with no code shouldn’t contain any license

Change-Id: I934b79cd4b799736c815f373cb3976b0daecf1a2
'}]
commit_message:
Enable hacking check H104

* [H104] Files with no code shouldn’t contain any license
         header nor comments, and must be left completely empty.

Change-Id: I934b79cd4b799736c815f373cb3976b0daecf1a2

commit_message:
jenkins jobs update

* add proper yaml multiline in jjb yaml jobs definition
* add collect artifacts if job fails into jjb job definition macros
* remove prepare_incubator_at function and its call from dashboard test job
* add sh -xe to the documentation build job launch

Change-Id: I4c07d4c55ee8833449b03294749710c3b9b568dc
Closes-Bug: 1340140

commit_message:
Propose Specification for non-persistent-tokens

Proposes specification for the non-persistent PKI token provider and
associated work.

Change-Id: I6b72466397823967d8183f01e57d46d717003b25

commit_message:
Enable skipped tests from test_models.py

Enable test_modelbase_iteritems and test_modelbase_iter which were
always skipped. These tests need a mapped object instead of
ModelBase instance.

Refactor ModelBaseTest a bit - move creation of ModelBase and
ExtraKeysModel instances to setUp().

Refactor test_modelbase_iteritems and test_modelbase_iter
to check if we can iterate over columns and extra_keys.

Co-Authored-By: Oleksii Chuprykov <ochuprykov@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1312220

Change-Id: If19137cc81959031764c1b78f990b67a8912a304

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 12:57:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fail docker build if puppet fails

Puppet does not return non-zero exit code if
there are errors during deployment.

FIXME: Cobbler has iptables bugs. Implement at future date.

commit_message:
Fail docker build if puppet fails

Puppet does not return non-zero exit code if
there are errors during deployment.

FIXME: Cobbler has iptables bugs. Implement at future date.

Change-Id: I86834cb62beac981e8c3defb8b2d90bafafb84b6
Closes-Bug: #1337288

(mainly virtual) that causes cobbler sync to
fail because httpd is not ready yet. Adding a

Closes-Bug: #1338552
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure web service starts before cobbler sync

An issue occurs on certain deployment types
(mainly virtual) that causes cobbler sync to
fail because httpd is not ready yet. Adding a
service check should cover this case.

Change-Id: Ibc47b3a970756fd7ed49e7fd5558bf24929f7a76
Closes-Bug: #1338552

commit_message:
Improve readability of long JQ expression

Inline single value from cidr.json.

Line everything up.

Unify expressions doing similar things.

Co-Author: Alexis Lee <alexisl@hp.com>
Change-Id: I41cfd0e5dfdf583492a65e3684bb812c0792084a

[{'created': '2014-07-17 09:36:08.000000000', 'message': 'Set default repos/puppets for releases

Since Fuel 5.1 repos/puppets paths are sent by Nailgun to Astute.
So we need to set defaults here, and remove them from Astute in
order to make our code more clear and centralized.

Change-Id: I9bc5d7f4a3de76dd09fb8e45f5d50969e8f19138
Closes-Bug: #1342168
'}]
commit_message:
Set default repos/puppets for releases

Since Fuel 5.1 repos/puppets paths are sent by Nailgun to Astute.
So we need to set defaults here, and remove them from Astute in
order to make our code more clear and centralized.

Change-Id: I9bc5d7f4a3de76dd09fb8e45f5d50969e8f19138
Closes-Bug: #1342168

Hi,
My main concern is backward compatibility. In Icehouse Glance and Ceilometer were released with the the oslo.vmware API.
The original thinking was do do a forlift of the code and then improve things.

It would be nice if the proposal had some concreate examples, for example you could use the attachemtn of a disk to a instance and the spawn to show the new usage and the old usage.

Thanks

commit_message:
Fix pep8 violations

These seem to have been introduced by:

cbd89e75d34c048c15c52dc828b1df7443c540d6

Locally I get

F401 '...' imported but unused

It turns out these are no longer needed, but I
don't understand why the pep8 gate did not complain;
a version mismatch somewhere?

Change-Id: I31c9d210ca77284b91426877333bd51bf2909ef0

Main issues: 

1) entry point into cluster_ha|simple is too low. and runs on every role. if this is right it should be above case, not below it.

2) some if {whole class}, the caller should know if its supposed to be called or not. This makes reading the manifests harder.

3) vmware_nsx.pp does both ! compute and "everything else" tasks, they need to be separate classes to improve reading and maintenance. 

4) core_plugin in vmware_nsx.pp is set to vmware. Please prepare translation to ML2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-03 20:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: -Verified

commit_message:
Implemantation of VMware NSX integration

Added new puppet module for Neutron NSX plugin integration.
* Separate classes for compute/controller
* Some additional paramenters required from Nailgun
* Hide some strange hacks with Anchors
* Add rdpkg and rrpm package managers in order to download
  packages from remote web-server using mask for a package name.
* Fix sanitaze_neutron_config to merge boolean values.

Change-Id: I94e7bf2fccc289d0d52fc3d3018db268ec4f7fff
Implements: blueprint neutron-nsx-plugin-integration

commit_message:
Expose recent docker features in the resource

This adds the name, port_bindings and links properties to the docker
container resource which are passed to container creation and start.
This also removes properties which were never implemented.

Change-Id: I7320e3a95895b894cc53ebb77ebb220482f990c1

commit_message:
heat_keystoneclient add get_user_token

Add a function which takes a stack domain username/password and
returns a token - this is for "one time" use, e.g for callback
signals to wait conditions via the native API.

blueprint: native-waitcondition

Change-Id: I6f4666728c5ecadb1d9d081fb825a77cd598fd47

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-16 06:08:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix run_tests.sh

With merge of commit:
https://github.com/stackforge/python-manilaclient/commit/ce35f9b847ab21df6f8e8aa6791b3c628cd68a1b

File run_tests.sh became broken, it tries to use old names of renamed files with dependencies:
tools/pip-requires → requirements.txt
tools/test-requires → test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Id83f55201ef01a9c3f7ee37406ac6070c4b14c5e
Closes-Bug: #1342538
'}]
commit_message:
Fix run_tests.sh

With merge of commit:
https://github.com/stackforge/python-manilaclient/commit/ce35f9b847ab21df6f8e8aa6791b3c628cd68a1b

File run_tests.sh became broken, it tries to use old names of renamed files with dependencies:
tools/pip-requires → requirements.txt
tools/test-requires → test-requirements.txt

Isn't the concept of an execution is internal to mistral? Why do we want to expose it through Solum's API? I think executions are internal to how pipelines are implemented."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2014-06-04 02:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMHO they are public. and wrapping everything is totally unnecessary. I believe solum should be "thin" and reuse as much of openstack as possible not be another cloudfoundry where we need to make things like heat and mistral swapable. This is one of the main things that distinguishes solum from other paas projects is our reuse of openstack. Note: with mistral you can totally plugin a different engine if you don't want the current implementation. I'd like us to be done with solum (because it's so simple) and add be able to instead work on the underlying services (heat/mistral/murano/glance/etc).'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2014-06-04 11:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-04 11:37:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2506, 'date': '2014-06-04 16:10:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Angus, Julien,

No disagreement on the appeal of the thought that lets do only as much as is really required in Solum and reuse other services where ever they make sense. In fact, we are already doing that. We are using Heat for orchestration, Keystone for auth, glance for storing images, etc. Similar to that, imo, we will be using Mistral for orchestrating the workflow aspects of Solum.

I guess the real question that I want to discuss is, should we think Solum as nothing more than Mistral workflow / Heat orchestration? Do you really think that should be the case?
There are so many app developer focused features that we want to support in Solum. CI, code gating, code reviews (in the future), git hosting (in the future), to name a few.
IMO, the abstract view that is required to be exposed by Solum to application developers is more than what a workflow system such as Mistral, or a orchestration system such as Heat
provides to the end users. Both those systems are tremendously useful in their own right. But they don't necessarily provide the right set of abstractions for application development purposes. Of course, we have discussed the point that advanced app developers should be able to just work with Heat template or Mistral workbooks if they want. And we definitely don't want to preclude that.

At this point the question that could be raised is why not just add things that are missing to Mistral and Heat to make them behave as Solum (i.e. the features that are needed for Solum, lets just add them to Heat and Mistral and ..). Well, even if we do that, the question still remains when an operator wants to provide Solum as a consumable service to application developers, what abstractions should they work with. There would need to be abstractions that are specific and relevant to Solum. In fact, Angus, you have already defined one such abstraction (that of Pipeline). I could ask, why did you not just use the workflow abstractions that are already defined in Mistral today? Because, I think, you rightly felt the need that the notion of a 'pipeline' is more closer to what an application developer is going to be working with than the notion of a workflow. So we are already thinking more in terms of the language that an app developer would use rather than the implementation view (which is internal to Solum). Are you saying we should add the concept of a 'pipeline' to Mistral? Does that notion make sense for Mistral? Probably not..

At this point another argument could be made is, well, use UI to define whatever new abstractions that we need. But at that point aren't those abstractions already part of Solum?

Anyways. Lets keep on debating.

I guess it comes down to thinking about pros and cons of defining Solum as no more than Mistral plus somethings or Heat plus somethings vs. thinking Solum in its own right as a system that provides an easy way for application developers to test and deploy apps to OpenStack.

Dev"}, {'account_id': 9095, 'date': '2014-06-04 19:07:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The problem I have with exposing Mistral DSL is that there are many things the user should not be aware of. Lets take the example Mistral DSL created here, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/95709/4/etc/solum/workbooks/build.yaml

Why should the end user know and define things like auth_token, base_image_id (which is the language pack id in the plan file), on-success actions, etc.

Users should not be concerned with these things. All they should be able to do is say 'yes/no' to a task which Solum supports, and if Yes, configure it further.  Dependency between tasks, internal solum/glance/keystone id's etc should be hidden."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2014-06-05 01:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add execution table to link to mistral

This is to keep track of the mistral executions that
are done for solum on each git push. This allows the
UI to be able to get detailed information on each pipeline
exection.

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/solum/+spec/pipeline
Change-Id: I10d3e6b911dd5e18973c5b5f9bfe83d88352df2b

I considered that but my thought was that the right thing to do is make the logic of the existing test correct as intended in one patch, and then consider making the test more robust in another test.

Once I had that thought I then started thinking "these tests in this file are pretty weak" and thought perhaps a larger refactoring was in order and wondered what the procedure is for that kind of thing. I don't (yet) know.'}, {'account_id': 8052, 'date': '2014-07-14 11:09:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think the timestamps were intended to be the same, I think the developer didn't consider that the timestamps are apparently only compared on the 'seconds' granularity."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2014-07-14 13:10:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-14 13:11:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix incorrect use of timestamp in test

The timestamp used has a very slim chance of being in
a different second than actually desired which would
tickle the bug. The bug itself is simply that the
mapping between sample and timestamp was incorrect.

To make sure that there isn't confusion over distinct
timestamps, _make_timestamps has been changed so that
if multiple timestamps are requested, each is a second
after the previous.

Change-Id: I22d999c506a30d4ca6b8dd7e9de501570257b99e
Closes-bug: 1341142

commit_message:
Add constant for ESX datacenter path (HTTP access)

This patch adds a constant.py file to store the constants needed in
the VMware ecosystem. A new constant is added for the ESX datacenter
path when using http access to datastores.

Change-Id: Ie5b84b3cc3913ab57f7ab487349557781cc4157a

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Fixes port update failure when device ID is not updated

The updation was failing because the changed_device_id variable
was undeclared.This fix declares the variable with a default value
at the beginning of the method.

Change-Id: I06dfea1170a6b2a649f4e1efe4bf70b7cee0eacb
Closes-Bug: 1337787

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
Move all db exception to exception.py

Moving InvalidSortKey, ColumnError  from oslo/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py to
oslo/db/exception.py for ease of use.
Add references in utils.py to exception py for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I38595d6bcceee84ef0ca7d88dae5617c006ba8c1

-1 because I think we should be more explicit about why we're skipping the _fast() check

But IIUIC and this is about the constants not being available, how about just mocking out the constants and avoiding this whole rabbit hole of porting the world to mock?

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 16:21:23.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: fix recent test changes to work on libvirt < 0.9.13

The newly used 'listAllDomains' method was only introduced in
libvirt 0.9.13. Although the driver code was written to cope
with older libvirt, the test suite code itself would fail
when faced with such an old libvirt because it was trying to
mock out methods which did not exist.

The fix here recognises that since '_list_instance_domains_fast'
and '_list_instance_domains_slow' both have explicit test cases,
there is no point in mocking out the low level 'listAllDomains'
method all all the other test cases. Instead we can mock out
the much higher level '_list_instance_domains' which means we
avoid any interaction with libvirt in these test cases. The
opportunity is taken to convert the tests in question to use
'mock' instead of 'mox' since it also simplifies the code.

Finally the test for '_list_instance_domains_fast' can simply
be skipped if the 'listAllDomains' method does not exist.

Closes-bug: 1341729
Change-Id: I554352ea14e6b3306176e7524502e005cebd8c16
"}, {'created': '2014-07-15 16:28:43.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: fix recent test changes to work on libvirt < 0.9.13

commit_message:
libvirt: fix recent test changes to work on libvirt < 0.9.13

The newly used 'listAllDomains' method was only introduced in
libvirt 0.9.13. Although the driver code was written to cope
with older libvirt, the test suite code itself would fail
when faced with such an old libvirt because it was trying to
mock out methods which did not exist.

The fix here recognises that since '_list_instance_domains_fast'
and '_list_instance_domains_slow' both have explicit test cases,
there is no point in mocking out the low level 'listAllDomains'
method in all the other test cases. Instead we can mock out
the much higher level '_list_instance_domains' which means we
avoid any interaction with libvirt in these test cases. The
opportunity is taken to convert the tests in question to use
'mock' instead of 'mox' since it also simplifies the code.

Finally in the test for '_list_instance_domains_fast' simply
skip the test if libvirt is too old to have the required
constants defined.

Closes-bug: 1341729
Change-Id: I554352ea14e6b3306176e7524502e005cebd8c16

commit_message:
Implement heat client plugin

This moves the client creation code out of Clients._heat() into
its own client plugin.

Clients._get_client_option is no longer used, so has been deleted

Change-Id: Ie14906b6cc605d6db49a5153ffa27f82debcc430

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-04 23:24:46.000000000', 'message': 'Implement ceilometer client plugin

This moves the client creation code out of Clients._ceilometer() into
its own client plugin.

Ceilometer is an integrated project, and python-ceilometerclient
is a dependency, so the import is now mandatory.

commit_message:
Implement ceilometer client plugin

This moves the client creation code out of Clients._ceilometer() into
its own client plugin.

Ceilometer is an integrated project, and python-ceilometerclient
is a dependency, so the import is now mandatory.

Change-Id: Id4961c4d9678d7bfe3739128843c41921cc8a34b

commit_message:
Implement trove client plugin

This moves the client creation code out of Clients._trove() into
its own client plugin.

Trove is an integrated project, and python-troveclient is a dependency,
so the import is now mandatory.

Change-Id: I89d290f6a38488779e77ff11bdfdd64c159a57e8

commit_message:
Enhanced tosca validation

Using new exception class instead of built-in exception types.
Added validation for tosca template field names.

Partially implements: blueprint tosca-validation
Implements: blueprint check-key-definition

Change-Id: Ic7a0f88157ddf89f8fc3247b76cdfc16a1670b9f

commit_message:
Fix tracking of SG's provisioned by Heat

Reasons:
 - Trove doesn't track security group that was created as
   a part of stack.
 - Trove should create two records for security group tracking:
   - security group;
   - security group association with an actual instance;

Changes:
 - Adding security groups registration right after stack creation.

Change-Id: I1f55c27ecbd5ad76c869eae7197b8c24720fc1e6
Closes-Bug: #1276228

commit_message:
Fix tests.unit.reports.* with python3.4

Sort all reports alphabetically to avoid dict key order issues in python2 or python3.

Change-Id: I3ceeba831ad93980ecf889e28bfdabf6204a9489

commit_message:
Mellanox OFED support OEM firmware

  1. create wrapper script in mlnx-ofed-light (change in mlnx-ofed-light-2.2.0-3)
  2. update ofed_install_with_sriov to call wrapper script

Closes-bug: #1336668
partially implements: blueprint mellanox-features-support
Signed-off-by: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>

Change-Id: Ib54ff5baf1308fab66bff4b1cc33e058c6b431a7

- check-tripleo-ironic-undercloud-precise http://logs.openstack.org/07/107407/1/check-tripleo/check-tripleo-ironic-undercloud-precise/78d0f61 : SUCCESS in 52m 13s'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2014-07-16 20:24:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This isn't fixing the problem, it's just obfuscating it under a warning. A user running this migration against SQLite is going to have a different schema as a result, and without that unique constraint, will have unexpected and probably buggy behavior.

SQLite supports UNIQUE constraints, so if we claim to support SQLite, we should have one."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2014-07-17 08:52:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

So alembic doesn't suport sqlite migrations[1]. Sometimes I think it's strange that we keep using sqlite for such tests locally and mysql on the gate (and probably production as well), maybe we should start talking about having mysql as the backend we use for our local tests as well?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/master/ironic/tests/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.conf#L4"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2014-07-17 11:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

viktors is working on better approaches to this and similar problems; I also reported https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1343195 to see what we can do'}]

commit_message:
Fix database migration with SQLite

SQLite does not seem to support ALTER for constraints, making
migration 3bea56f25597_add_unique_constraint_to_instance_uuid fail.
This patch turns error into a warning.

Change-Id: Ib7338e956e6d1a29c92594174e277cf884086912

commit_message:
Adding OFED drivers installation

1. adding OFED pre req to CentOS if mlnx enabled
2. adding OFED installation at kickstart postinstall
3. adding OFED pre req to Ubuntu if mlnx enabled
4. adding OFED installation to preseed late command

partially implements: blueprint mellanox-features-support
Signed-off-by: Moshe Levi <moshele@mellanox.com>

Change-Id: I10d1e26aff99f6d6360a6de6f1f385d1c28157d9

commit_message:
Stop overriding CONF.default_log_levels per binary

Overriding CONF.default_log_levels means we loose some explicitly set
default values such as 'iso8601=WARN'. Also explicitly overriding
CONF.default_log_levels means that default_log_levels cannot be set in a
config file.

Change-Id: Ib5103b88ec3f9ccd9d516032c6a13dc2fa4bcb5e

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-16 18:03:50.000000000', 'message': "Pass user_creds_id when creating backup stack

When creating a backup stack on update, we don't want to create a
new user_creds record, or update won't work with a trust-scoped
token.  So instead pass the existing stack user_creds_id in to the
constructor when creating the backup stack.

The current behavior is actually doubly wrong, since we don't delete
user_creds records when deleting the backup stack, so the stale
creds records are probably left behind in the DB.

Change-Id: I6bd0568fdf5301b876c40acddc73542bcfc224e3
Partial-Bug: #1342593
"}]
commit_message:
Pass user_creds_id when creating backup stack

When creating a backup stack on update, we don't want to create a
new user_creds record, or update won't work with a trust-scoped
token.  So instead pass the existing stack user_creds_id in to the
constructor when creating the backup stack.

The current behavior is actually doubly wrong, since we don't delete
user_creds records when deleting the backup stack, so the stale
creds records are probably left behind in the DB.

Change-Id: I6bd0568fdf5301b876c40acddc73542bcfc224e3
Partial-Bug: #1342593

commit_message:
Add all neutron packages to requirements

It has come up in several requests that we should have packages present for
 all of the neutron components so that any patches we might have included are
 present in the repos on the fuel-master.

This is not intended to be a "fuel suppports ..." but rather enables users to
 customize their deployment accordingly and not have to find packages that
 where not built from the same sources which would cause more problems for
 them.

Closes-bug: #1330610
Related-blueprint: ml2-neutron

Change-Id: Ic1c6397f5eb73694162b0c01b83bcdd11e27cb54

In the inline comments, it is discussed whether this change should be a part of the subsequent patch or not. Either way seems good to me. If this patch is unnecessary, feel free to abandon.'}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2014-07-16 19:43:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I looked in https://review.openstack.org/76520 and did not see oslotest being directly used. Digging deeper I found that it is oslo.db that has oslotest in its test-requirements. I don't think it's possible to get neutron's test-requirements to inherit oslo.db's test-requirements? So since https://review.openstack.org/76520 is responsible for importing oslo.db.sqlalchemy.test_base which needs oslotest, I am leaning (slightly) towards combining this requirement with that change."}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2014-07-17 08:04:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fixes the order of assertEqual arguments

assertEqual method's arguments should be in
('expected', 'actual') order.

Change-Id: I524113ccc4a00e8363b2f9c418a3754f482b44d0

Give more clear message about orchestrator logs

Show more specify message about logs: Astute
instead of Orchestrator

commit_message:
Make javelin check logging a bit better

Add some more logging to javelin to help us figure out where 'check' is
failing.

Change-Id: Iea1ad2d11620bdd30692d7a11af8963531379c14

[{'created': '2014-07-17 09:13:13.000000000', 'message': 'Identify the flavor popover by the instance ID

The popover of the flavor details have to be identified by the instance ID
and not by the flavor ID. When having multiple instances in a listing with
the same flavor the identification with the flavor ID is not working.

Change-Id: Idab13aae6eb0d96df89638d319b3f94d54d6c6ca
'}]
commit_message:
Identify the flavor popover by the instance ID

The popover of the flavor details have to be identified by the instance ID
and not by the flavor ID. When having multiple instances in a listing with
the same flavor the identification with the flavor ID is not working.

Change-Id: Idab13aae6eb0d96df89638d319b3f94d54d6c6ca

This adds a test to ensure that the new behavior of the metadata
API handler persists. It's important that it uses the special
constant_time_compare() method.

Change-Id: I1253661f74dae822be9dc9fe1fdab861ebd64bc9

commit_message:
Make sure that metadata handler uses constant_time_compare()

This adds a test to ensure that the new behavior of the metadata
API handler persists. It's important that it uses the special
constant_time_compare() method.

Change-Id: I1253661f74dae822be9dc9fe1fdab861ebd64bc9

resources:
  database_password:
    type: "OS::Heat::RandomString"
    properties:
      length: 16
      sequence: lettersdigits

  service_db:
    type: OS::Trove::Instance
    properties:
      name: app_db
      flavor: { get_param: db_flavor }
      size: { get_param: db_size }
      databases:
      - name: app_data
      users:
      - name: { get_param: db_user }
        password: { get_attr: [database_password, value] }

If we skip property values validation for the resources which depend on others, when to validate the property values? 1. currently property value is validated each time property is accessed (https://github.com/openstack/heat/blob/master/heat/engine/properties.py#L336)

2. yes, we can record and validate property explicitly, but in my opinion it is not of much use'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-19 20:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Verified

commit_message:
Fix early resource property value validation

Currently resource property validation fails if resource it
depends on is not created.

This change skips a property constraint validation if its intrinsic
function resolution does not find the dependant resource.

Change-Id: I2056c89437e8df2a59726b60c3c12f19f713d84d
Partial-Bug: #1317636

commit_message:
Adds Continue macro to MuranoPL

Continue is a complimentary operator to Break

Change-Id: I85892d6e0fa373d31754e6830ce44f9c528f79d4
Implements: blueprint muranopl-continue-operator

commit_message:
Unit tests for macro blocks

Also:
 * fixes local variable scope for several macro
 * make thrown exceptions be more descriptive
 * parsing error happened when Limit for ParallelCode was integer (and not expression)
 * improved Break support

Change-Id: Ie17240c2d343014ce3da9ddc6577cf93cf99b106
Closes-Bug: #1337512
Partial-Bug: #1316786

commit_message:
Avoid possible timing attack in metadata api

Introduce a constant time comparison function to
nova utils for comparing authentication tokens.

Change-Id: I7374f2edc6f03c7da59cf73ae91a87147e53d0de
Closes-bug: #1325128

commit_message:
Update the way hard & soft reboots are displayed in task result

Currently the task result output does not distinguish between
nova hard and soft reboots. Following patch add this function.
The hard reboot will displayed as is nova.reboot_server and
soft reboot will be displayed as nova.soft_reboot_server.

Change-Id: I22ea2ddcf5c1a58697286ff292fb6a2a5fcaaee6
Closes-Bug:#1342138

<SnowDust> there is one setting similar to it 
<SnowDust> datastore_registry_opts
<SlickNik> Yes, and for that we _always_ load the defaults.
<SnowDust> ok ok 
<SnowDust> i understood the intention 
<SnowDust> the conf shall "append" and not "replace" the defaults
<SnowDust> thats the intention

So heres what i think should happen.

1) Dont put these in an options.py. They are best placed _in_ the datastore_manager itself.

2) Pull the datastores.datastore_manager from the datastores table, and then magically import those. that will pull in the cfg groups that are _in_ the datastore_manager modules.

benefits are: you can keep the cfg.groups in their datastore_managers w/o having to have a new file (which could be forgotten by new developers), and you can still import them at startup in the cfg. This is the best option.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-27 17:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: -Verified

commit_message:
datastore opts loaded with module entrypoint

options related to a datastore may be loaded from
a module entrypoint which gives the following enhancement

1. Keeps the same behaviour with existing code

2. Enables the config variable [DEFAULT]custom_datastore_options
   for trove-taskmanger.conf and trove.conf,
   which are loaded with --config-file= in command line.

   For an experimental/custom datastore perspective,
   options may be loaded without touching cfg.py
   by adding custom_datastore_options in the conf file itself.

Implements: blueprint refactoring-datastore-options-in-cfg

Change-Id: I97fb0f63b595409d8d4c01f09fdae608c2769d5a

commit_message:
Correct the return of "keystone service-create"

In keystone-service documentation, the return of "keystone service-create"
is missing "enabled" field, this change fix it.
Additionally, this change fix some aligning error of this
documentation, and redundant return of "keystone service-delete"

Change-Id: I5b17fea3e322483310ec5d07b755d80fc25759ce
Closes-Bug: #1341184

[{'created': '2014-07-16 09:58:54.000000000', 'message': "Try fetching index.html from swift

OpenStack returns a directory of log files back to gerrit. Swift
has no good way of listing this directory. However we'll upload our
own index.html along with the files so we need to check for that.

If we have 404'd (or failed) on fetching from swift we should try

Change-Id: I1a85a841283ba5f40880356278d5d588139eed7e

OpenStack returns a directory of log files back to gerrit. Swift
has no good way of listing this directory. However we'll upload our

commit_message:
Try fetching index.html from swift

OpenStack returns a directory of log files back to gerrit. Swift
has no good way of listing this directory. However we'll upload our
own index.html along with the files so we need to check for that.

If we have 404'd (or failed) on fetching from swift we should try
seeing if an 'index.html' exists.

Change-Id: I1a85a841283ba5f40880356278d5d588139eed7e

commit_message:
VPNaaS: separate out validation logic for ref impl

Modify the persistence logic for VPNaaS to separate out the
validation for the reference implmentation. This allows
providers to override/extend the validation, as needed.
Additional commits will address the separation for other
providers and for other L3 services.

In addition, the logic that sets default values for optional
attributes is also moved into separate methods to allow
providers to override the defaults used.

Only attributes that have multiple validations are considered
at this time, but this can be extended, as needed.

Currently, one UT fails due to an oslo.messaging bug that
has been fixed, but not yet released for Neutron use.
As a workaround, the affected test case has been commented
out. This test verifies that the right (only, in this case)
device driver is used for validation. Once the issue with
releasing oslo.messaging 1.4.0.0a2 or newer is resolved,
this can be uncommented.

In the future, TaskFlow may be used for the L3 services workflow,
and these changes will provide validation modularization for that
effort.

Change-Id: Id420983ccbceece5f4a00546941618318b9562c7
Partially-implements: blueprint l3-svcs-vendor-validation

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 12:27:12.000000000', 'message': 'Retry db.api.instance_destroy on deadlock

Update the instance_destroy method of the sqlalchemy db API to retry if
it fails because of a deadlock. The decorator that handles this was
introduced in I0293c62d2dd5ac036445bc639cabbd05ba016e83.

This patch does not include a unit test for this bug, as deadlocks are
very hard to reproduce.

Change-Id: I570d91e892a6e1ff4b3cdb8cf81acc483649835e
Closes-Bug: #1342086
'}]
commit_message:
Retry db.api.instance_destroy on deadlock

Update the instance_destroy method of the sqlalchemy db API to retry if
it fails because of a deadlock. The decorator that handles this was
introduced in I0293c62d2dd5ac036445bc639cabbd05ba016e83.

This patch does not include a unit test for this bug, as deadlocks are
very hard to reproduce.

Change-Id: I570d91e892a6e1ff4b3cdb8cf81acc483649835e
Closes-Bug: #1342086

commit_message:
Use hmac.compare_digest to compare signature

hmac.compare_digest must be used to compare sample
signature to avoid timing-attack.

We also provide a best-effort version of hmac.compare_digest
for python version that doesn't have the C version.

Closes bug #1332390

Change-Id: Ia313c98b7cccf0e8aed4fb933292bd7e6141b801

commit_message:
move setup_localrc to functions.sh

* Have the devstack-vm-gate.sh to be able to call functions
  from the functions.sh.
* allow setup_localrc to be called from a different script,
  without executing the full devstack-vm-gate.sh.

NOTE: setup_localrc will be modified to behave differently on 'primary'
and 'sub' nodes, in multi-node setup.

Change-Id: Ic5b2b7ba8fe44bdf9a1648f68a9677ad1ab788d9

subject: Makes devtest_seed.sh respect local.json
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 215, 'name': 'Jon-Paul Sullivan', 'email': 'j3p0uk@hotmail.com', 'username': 'jonpaul-sullivan'}, {'_account_id': 1865, 'name': 'Andrea Rosa', 'email': 'andrea.rosa@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-rosa-m'}, {'_account_id': 8153, 'name': 'Thom "tteggel" Leggett', 'email': 'thom@tteggel.org', 'username': 'tteggel'}, {'_account_id': 8688, 'name': 'Alexis Lee', 'email': 'openstack@lxsli.co.uk', 'username': 'lxsli'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8153, 'date': '2014-07-10 16:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 16:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 16:39:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-tripleo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/99/106099/1/check/gate-tripleo-incubator-docs/d6dcb2e/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 29s'}, {'account_id': 1865, 'date': '2014-07-10 16:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I think the warning message is not correct or at least not clear.'}, {'account_id': 215, 'date': '2014-07-10 16:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

My understanding is that local.json is not a precious file.  It is a generated file from a combination of inputs, these being config.json and testenv.json among others.

I believe that testenv.json is where user configurable and reusable data is intended to live.'}, {'account_id': 8688, 'date': '2014-07-10 16:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

If you remove the warning, I think this could be merged.'}, {'account_id': 8688, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

to explain: although local.json is "user input" as far as the element is concerned, devtest acts as that user. This is why the deprecation warning is incorrect - devtest is using the element correctly (according to its README at least).

However for debug purposes one may want to be able to tweak local.json. devtest will reset anything it wants to, so there's no issue here.

BTW commit message needs rewriting, it misunderstands the relationship between the element + devtest.'}, {'account_id': 8153, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:03:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

JP: My use case here is to be enable debug logging in nova on the seed to troubleshoot an undercloud standup issue. I can't do that from testenv.json.

The code in t-i-e/elements/seed-stack-config suggests that you should copy config.json to local.json and make your config changes there. Unfortunately devtest_seed.sh then blats my changes in local.json hence this patch.

Any other way to achieve use case this without this patch welcome :)

Andrea: I copied this message from t-i-e/elements/seed-stack-config for consistency. I agree that it's not as clear as it could be but would rather both deprecation messages are the same."}, {'account_id': 8153, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-tripleo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/99/106099/2/check/gate-tripleo-incubator-docs/a227c3f/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 02s'}, {'account_id': 8688, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 8688, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Changed the commit message'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 17:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-tripleo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/99/106099/3/check/gate-tripleo-incubator-docs/63d4437/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 49s'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 19:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- check-tripleo-undercloud-precise http://logs.openstack.org/99/106099/3/check-tripleo/check-tripleo-undercloud-precise/c580f54 : SUCCESS in 38m 16s
- check-tripleo-ironic-undercloud-precise http://logs.openstack.org/99/106099/3/check-tripleo/check-tripleo-ironic-undercloud-precise/dfd0fc2 : SUCCESS in 42m 36s
- check-tripleo-overcloud-f20 http://logs.openstack.org/99/106099/3/check-tripleo/check-tripleo-overcloud-f20/24467a9 : SUCCESS in 1h 17m 45s'}, {'account_id': 215, 'date': '2014-07-10 20:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

An alternative, with no code changes to submit, would be to add jq lines into devtest to add your configuration to the generated json.

Doing that means this patch isn't necessary at all.

I fear that this patch will cause problems for people running devtest if the config.json changes and they do not blow-away their generated local.json file.

But we can let the cores decide, I guess."}, {'account_id': 8688, 'date': '2014-07-11 10:04:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

OK, that is a risk. I was on the side of letting Thom build his bikeshed, but I don't think he really cares any more so lets maintain status quo."}, {'account_id': 8153, 'date': '2014-07-11 10:28:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I don't care inasmuch as I've used this patch to debug my issue with the seed. 

However I do think that devtest should have the ability to override seed configs. The way things are now we cannot exploit the mechanism that the element provides for doing this and the current behaviour will be confusing for anyone who has used the element.

JP - could you elaborate on your comment about about devtest using jq to do this?

I'd rather exploit the mechanism that the element provides than grow more ExtraConfig type machinery just for the seed but I do take your point about the risk of a stale local.json. Maybe we could change this patch to support a seed-config.json in $TRIPLEO_ROOT instead of local.json tucked away in the element?"}, {'account_id': 215, 'date': '2014-07-11 12:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Sure - the existing code merges a lot of json together, so it's just a case of doing the same for the extra values that you want.

So just around the generate-keystone-pki call (before the final local.json is written out), you could add something like:

    jq -s '.[0].ironic.verbose="True"|.[0].nova.verbose|="True"' tmp_local.json > new_tmp_local.json
    mv new_tmp_local.json tmp_local.json

And this would add those settings to the relevant sections.'}, {'account_id': 8153, 'date': '2014-07-17 08:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not going to add complexity for something that can be simple. Will keep this patch in my local toolbox.'}]

commit_message:
Makes devtest_seed.sh respect local.json

The seed-stack-config element expects you to copy config.json
to local.json and add your seed settings. Devtest does this for
you but it ignores an existing local.json, which you may have
tweaked.

Update devtest_seed.sh so it will use local.json in preference
to config.json if it exists.

Change-Id: I0a3765c56352a4bca3d260b45774ce6ee098d806

commit_message:
Deterministic uid/gid usage

Allow to specify UID on devstack gate,
in-order to ensure the same UID/GID can be used in multi-node setups.

Change-Id: I4a782c47d1ba1ead0354dba613017e12ecea02e6

commit_message:
Support multiple Cinder backend types

This is the first step in supporting multiple Cinder backend types at
once.  It initially converts the existing hard-coded multi-lvm support
to a new cinder_backends driver form.  Eventually the cinder_plugins
will be converted to this form so they can be enabled more than just
one at a time using CINDER_ENABLED_BACKENDS.

The default configuration should be identical to the previous defaults,
including for both True and False values of CINDER_MULTI_LVM_BACKEND.

The existing cinder_plugins are expected to be removed when this is
complete. They should continue to work until they have been converted.

Add wait for c-api to ensure it is started before continuing.

Change-Id: I93b8ef32832269d730c76a6dc24ddb4f20c6d9df

commit_message:
Additional configuration steps for HEAT on RHEL

Added steps on configuring HEAT service to use
Qpid as the messaging broker.

Updated the editing steps to add keystone_authoken
and ec2authtoken to use openstack-config to modify
the heat.conf file as the other configuration
editing in this section uses openstack-config.

Closes-Bug: 1331050

Change-Id: I1caac81c8b4e019e56c9f1cbf8ad75d938aa3ebb

commit_message:
Test that tenant list function can use auth_url

Listing tenants can be done on the auth URL because it is often needed
to be performed with an unscoped token. The behaviour is not tested
though so add a test to cover it.

Change-Id: Ic14d54f0f1d8cca2c3a5a6a6da7465c703773aa0

[{'created': '2014-07-14 07:41:34.000000000', 'message': 'ofagent: Handle device name prefixes other than "tap"

This fixes regressions in commit 9d13ea884bff749b3975acb5eb5630e5aca4a665.

Handle device name prefixes other than "tap".
For example, nova hybrid interface driver uses "qvo" prefix.

Also, ignore non neutron ports correctly.  For example, veth pairs
used to connect physical bridges.

Closes-Bug: #1341465
Change-Id: I1d71c8a2cf8c2f71f0dbcfb54c9b347e24c03562
'}]
commit_message:
ofagent: Handle device name prefixes other than "tap"

This fixes regressions in commit 9d13ea884bff749b3975acb5eb5630e5aca4a665.

Handle device name prefixes other than "tap".
For example, nova hybrid interface driver uses "qvo" prefix.

Also, ignore non neutron ports correctly.  For example, veth pairs
used to connect physical bridges.

Closes-Bug: #1341465
Change-Id: I1d71c8a2cf8c2f71f0dbcfb54c9b347e24c03562

Hi Swaminathan, Armando, I've tested router-update operation with this patch, trying to convert existing router from centralized to distributed, and got a stack trace/Internal server error.
The issue was in accessing router_db.extra_attributes.distributed in several places in the code (particularly, File "/opt/stack/neutron/neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py", line 71, in _validate_router_migration)

Per proposed migration, for existing centralized routers router_db.extra_attributes is None, so this case should be handled separately.

Also it makes sense to add UT to check this particular case when router was created by pre-dvr code'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-15 09:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: -Verified

I will verify, and many thanks for spotting this!"}, {'account_id': 7448, 'date': '2014-06-17 06:05:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25: Code-Review-1

'}, {'created': '2014-05-29 23:55:34.000000000', 'message': "Add L3 Extension for Distributed Routers

This patch introduces the model and extension
framework for implementing distributed virtual
routing on top of Open vSwitch.

A new admin-only 'distributed' (as opposed to a
'centralized' or legacy-mode) attribute is added
to the API router resource. It is possible to convert
an existing (centralized) router to a distributed
one; the opposite conversion, even though allowed by
the API, may not be honored by the underlying
plugin implementation.

When creating a router (regardless of the user role),
Neutron will rely on a system wide configuration, whose
default currently allows to create 'centralized' routers.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7227fbe2718eba6665a5afb5dcaaaa77b341091f
"}, {'created': '2014-05-29 23:58:38.000000000', 'message': "Add L3 Extension for Distributed Routers

to the API router resource. It is possible to convert
an existing (centralized) router to a distributed
one; the opposite conversion, even though allowed by
the API, may not be honored by the underlying
plugin implementation.

When creating a router (regardless of the user role),
Neutron will rely on a system wide configuration, whose
default currently allows to create 'centralized' routers.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7227fbe2718eba6665a5afb5dcaaaa77b341091f
Authored-by:    Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2014-06-04 20:22:49.000000000', 'message': "Add L3 Extension for Distributed Routers

This patch introduces the model and extension
framework for implementing distributed virtual

to the API router resource. It is possible to convert

'centralized' or legacy-mode) attribute is added
to the API router resource. It is possible to convert
an existing (centralized) router to a distributed
one; the opposite conversion, even though allowed by
the API, may not be honored by the underlying
plugin implementation and an appropriate error will
be reported.

When creating a router (regardless of the user role),
Neutron will rely on a system wide configuration, whose
default currently allows to create 'centralized' routers.

Tests are added for basic unit coverage; when the first
building blocks for neutron-testing-refactor
are complete, functional testing will be added.
This is because we should be moving away from how
extension tests have been done up until now.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7227fbe2718eba6665a5afb5dcaaaa77b341091f
Authored-by:    Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>

routing on top of Open vSwitch.

A new admin-only 'distributed' (as opposed to a
'centralized' or legacy-mode) attribute is added
to the API router resource. It is possible to convert
an existing (centralized) router to a distributed
one; the opposite conversion, even though allowed by
the API, may not be honored by the underlying
plugin implementation and an appropriate error will
be reported.

When creating a router (regardless of the user role),
Neutron will rely on a system wide configuration, whose
default currently allows to create 'centralized' routers.

Tests are added for basic unit coverage; when the first
building blocks for neutron-testing-refactor
are complete, functional testing will be added.
This is because we should be moving away from how
extension tests have been done up until now.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add L3 Extension for Distributed Routers

This patch introduces the model and extension
framework for implementing distributed virtual
routing on top of Open vSwitch.

A new admin-only 'distributed' (as opposed to a
'centralized' or legacy-mode) attribute is added
to the API router resource. It is possible to convert
an existing (centralized) router to a distributed
one; the opposite conversion, even though allowed by
the API, may not be honored by the underlying
plugin implementation and an appropriate error will
be reported.

When creating a router (regardless of the user role),
Neutron will rely on a system wide configuration, whose
default currently allows to create 'centralized' routers.

Tests are added for basic unit coverage; when the first
building blocks for neutron-testing-refactor
are complete, functional testing will be added.
This is because we should be moving away from how
extension tests have been done up until now.

Partially-implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7227fbe2718eba6665a5afb5dcaaaa77b341091f
Authored-by:    Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Armando Migliaccio <armamig@gmail.com>

commit_message:
change the firewall debugging for clarity

When we are building rules ensure we log the instance['id'] so
we can actually correlate the iptables output to UUID for the
instance.

Also bundle up the security group to iptables translation to a
final view of the world instead of the piecemeal rule at a time
view.

Display what rules are being skipped in the add process, as the
skips seem to happen a lot. If this is completely normal we should
probably delete the bit entirely at some later point.

Related-Bug: #1298472

Change-Id: I0e90c3af9bf908b733ed895ad7c204b0a95ef786

commit_message:
Add 'anon' kwarg to FakeDbBlockDeviceDict class

This will allow us to create fake block devices without the database id
field, so we can pass them to BDM objects in our test  which can then
call create(). create() would normally error out if there is a DB id set
on the object.

Change-Id: I2d1f975633c8b2cb9e2e744c5f769b8f753b5968

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy module

Changes -
 * pep8: fixed multiple violations
 * Prevent races in opportunistic db test cases
 * Fix Sphinx directive name

Change-Id: Ibc42553bf3730e02a4c98bdfad1509f16d16cb61

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator threadgroup modules

Changes -
 * Make stop_timers() method public
 *  Add graceful stop function to ThreadGroup.stop

Change-Id: I75260a6401c86a1cbf54cd48ce6dbfe58baea784

Add v2 Token manager authenticate tests

This function is currently completely untested. Create tests to
reinforce behaviour.

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator processutils module

Changes -
 * Fix exception message in openstack.common.processutils.execute
 * Remove `processutils` dependency on `log`
 * Fix broken formatting of processutils.execute log statement
 * Move nova.utils.cpu_count() to processutils module

Change-Id: Ic4b65ffc35ecea3580c984e5417e1ecdcf9c95ca

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator periodic_task module

Changes -
 * Make periodic tasks run on regular spacing interval
 * Fix parenthesis typo misunderstanding in periodic_task

Change-Id: Iab11103942ebe9b2e94c68f97f885a0877e206bb

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator network_utils module

Changes -
 * Use the standard python logging in network_utils
 * Set pbr 'warnerrors' option for doc build
 * Avoid raising index error when no host

Change-Id: I98bc7190b3ff63ac37b0993ccffffadd1163a89c

commit_message:
Migrate default extensions

When running `keystone-manage db_sync` with no parameters, none of
the extensions are migrated.

This patch will now, by default, migrate the following extensions:
  revoke

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Steve Martinelli <stevemar@ca.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: 1324260
Change-Id: I4711e8670bf9619b9bccc09bd6a843728230b25f

commit_message:
move the cloudpipe_update API v2 extension to use objects

This change converts the cloudpipe_update extension to use the Network
object instead of direct database access.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: Ie4f800e05dae9aafd6f0f11ef0f2cd9ecf0d3215

commit_message:
Fix mistakes in token fixtures

There are two small mistakes i discovered in the token fixtures. Fix
these and add a bunch of new tests that would have caught them earlier.

Closes-Bug: #1342513
Closes-Bug: #1342515
Change-Id: I7c07bd915fd84cc77cae0004220d8bb8d79bb082

commit_message:
add python-mock to testonly package list

Python-mock is needed by most of OpenStack for testability. Add
this is a testonly package. This should fix current issues with
functional tests in OpenStack that use devstack, but not tox to
run their tests.

Closes-Bug: #1341507

Change-Id: I26cbe42ace75554bae993a6d849c3b4ac649c78e

commit_message:
Make Token Data fixtures positional

All arguments to Token Data fixtures should be passed as keyword
arguments not positional arguments.

Change-Id: Iabc6b7f11dce80a2009cc6a3e4bc6150f582f3da

commit_message:
Use auth_token from keystonemiddleware

auth_token middleware in python-keystoneclient is deprecated and has
been moved to the keystonemiddleware repo.

Closes-Bug: #1342274

Change-Id: I1aadbe24db63eb2507b088cd53886d7f2e192cab

commit_message:
Pass token expiry to the .create_token() method

Pass the token expiry directly to the .create_token() method as
an argument instead as part of the token_data blob. This is a
prerequisite of collapsing the token_ref data to not need
to store token data twice (which is a prerequisite of moving to
ephemeral tokens).

Change-Id: I88802efe5e44a4c4eb823eae42066561038c0f9c
bp: non-persistent-tokens

commit_message:
By default enable memcache for Keystone

Enable cache for Keystone (memcached) by default. This will utilize
the dogpile.cache based caching layer.

Change-Id: I91bbf8f9bbaf28cd411dfd13dfe9659ca322487b

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 14:01:49.000000000', 'message': "Append to a remote existing file

Sahara utils remote can only create a new file and write to it or
replace a line for a new one, but it can't append to an existing file.
This bp aims to implement this feature.

Change-Id: I935df7e14946d9e69f2b55ffebe61e05d2493785
Implements: blueprint append-to-remote-file

commit_message:
Append to a remote existing file

Sahara utils remote can only create a new file and write to it or
replace a line for a new one, but it can't append to an existing file.
This bp aims to implement this feature.

Change-Id: I935df7e14946d9e69f2b55ffebe61e05d2493785
Implements: blueprint append-to-remote-file

I assume you have found a reason for requiring SQLAlchemy>=0.8.4 and alembic>=0.6.2? I am not sure how easy the process of getting the global requirements updated is.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2014-06-22 06:58:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

@Henry Gessau

I don't forget about error that you've got. I understand the reason why its appear and I'm working on finding the way how to fixed it. This error appears because foreign keys are not checking and if there is extra foreign keys script finds out only extra index(for MySQL) that it tries to drop. In fact this problem I try to solve earlier in https://review.openstack.org/80518 but it was abandoned because of Mark's comment.

The problem of requirements should be discussed as to have all necessary checks we need to have this versions of sqlalchemy and alembic.(the current version is not able to check unique constraints, for example)"}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2014-06-22 13:05:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Works for me.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2014-07-15 17:41:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 41: Code-Review+2

I am happy with this patch.

Only caveat is that I've seen that the following sequence of operations (with NSX plugin)

git review -d 96438

sudo python setup.py develop

neutron-db-manage --config-file ... current

Current revision for mysql://root:XXXXX@127.0.0.1/neutron_nsx?charset=utf8: 5ac1c354a051 -> icehouse, icehouse

neutron-db-manage --config-file ... upgrade head

neutron-db-manage --config-file ... current

Current revision for mysql://root:XXXXX@127.0.0.1/neutron_nsx?charset=utf8: 5446f2a45467 -> db_healing (head), Include all tables and make migrations unconditional.

neutron-db-manage --config-file ... downgrade icehouse

neutron-db-manage --config-file ... upgrade head

results in the following being emitted after the 2nd upgrade. I think the healing migration should be pretty much a no-op in this case and therefore I'm not sure those INFO messages should be there. This might be something we could address with a follow up patch, if necessary.

INFO  [alembic.migration] Running upgrade 5446f2a45467 -> db_healing, Include all tables and make migrations unconditional.

INFO  [alembic.migration] Context impl MySQLImpl.

INFO  [alembic.migration] Will assume non-transactional DDL.

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected removed table u'servicedefinitions'

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected removed table u'servicetypes'

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected NULL on column 'cisco_ml2_apic_contracts.tenant_id'

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected server default on column 'cisco_ml2_apic_contracts.tenant_id'

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected NULL on column 'tz_network_bindings.phy_uuid'

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected server default on column 'tz_network_bindings.phy_uuid'

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected NULL on column 'tz_network_bindings.vlan_id'

INFO  [alembic.autogenerate.compare] Detected server default on column 'tz_network_bindings.vlan_id'"}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2014-07-15 18:10:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

lgtm!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-15 18:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 41: -Verified

commit_message:
Database healing migration

Add script that will add all tables for all plugins and make db schema
unconditional.

partially implement bp: db-migration-refactor

Closes-bug: #1277379
Closes-bug: #1304741
Closes-bug: #1298456
Closes-bug: #1298461
Closes-bug: #1239974
Closes-bug: #1336177
Closes-bug: #1337185

Change-Id: Ie49088a74bc5a87466f46989ce14d935e27567d1

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-07-15 13:03:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

What is the problem you're actually trying to address here - please provide a bug report showing it.

Just inventing a new NIC name like this isn't really viable. The libvirt supported model name for a virtio NIC is 'virtio' not 'virtio-net' - if the latter works, it is merely by accident not design and so cannot be relied upon."}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2014-07-15 13:20:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Qemu DOES support it. This patch simply uses qemu driver as backend for the bridge interface. Instead of using VHOST, which runs kernelspace code, it just uses qemu driver (userspace). This is equivalent to driver name='qemu'. The goal is to provide more flexibility to users that don't want to use kernelspace code."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-07-15 13:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

You are relying on an accidental bug in libvirt. 'virtio' is the network model libvirt supports, and it changes that to 'virtio-net' when generating the QEMU args. 'virtio-net' is *not* supported in libvirt XML and so using that is liable to break in the future."}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2014-07-15 13:37:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Is the following config in libvirt the right way to address the goal of not using VHOST ? I confirm I tested this config and it works fine.

<model type='virtio'>
<driver name='qemu'>"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-07-15 13:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, setting the driver name to QEMU is the official way to disable vhost. I still question why this is desired / required for openstack to support though. What is the compelling functional reason for disabling vhost mode - it largely serves to just make networking slower.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-15 13:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- check-devstack-dsvm-cells http://logs.openstack.org/68/106868/3/check/check-devstack-dsvm-cells/2e638a7 : SUCCESS in 13m 55s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-large-ops http://logs.openstack.org/68/106868/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-large-ops/384a60b : SUCCESS in 17m 41s
- gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-large-ops http://logs.openstack.org/68/106868/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-large-ops/7925f7c : SUCCESS in 17m 25s
- gate-nova-pylint http://logs.openstack.org/68/106868/3/check/gate-nova-pylint/6f92522 : SUCCESS in 15m 12s (non-voting)
- check-grenade-dsvm-partial-ncpu http://logs.openstack.org/68/106868/3/check/check-grenade-dsvm-partial-ncpu/b68b81c : SUCCESS in 44m 26s
- check-tempest-dsvm-virtual-ironic-nv http://logs.openstack.org/68/106868/3/check/check-tempest-dsvm-virtual-ironic-nv/5a8ff6f : SUCCESS in 31m 53s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2014-07-15 14:17:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Mainly due to bugs and to give more flexibility for qemu. When kernelspace code path breaks for some reason, you have an alternate userspace driver to use (qemu). It's just one more option for virtio to work when specific problems happen with kernelspace code."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-07-15 14:26:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Well if the kernel is broken, then obviously that should be fixed. If the kernel is broken, then simply temporarily blacklisting the vhost-net kernel module would prevent it from being used by OpenStack without any config needed on Nova's part."}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2014-07-15 15:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Thanks for reviewing Berrange. The vhost-net workaround is ok. Also we have other supported drivers that we can use. The idea was to give one more option and use qemu driver instead of vhost.'}]

commit_message:
Add support to virtio without vhost for qemu userspace driver

While virtio uses vhost (kernel space driver), virtio-net uses qemu
user space driver. This patch enables virtio without vhost on qemu
by passing model type='virtio-net'.

Change-Id: I996faa02ec38ec6113105fdf26a6b20ca1f7a039

commit_message:
Translations: add LC to all LOG.critical messages

Update all instance of this in the code.

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105675/ deals with the
other case.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I31e2a18d94bb4d8a88d99669b31181a1dea7ad05

commit_message:
Handle over quota exception from Neutron

When using the floating IP in Nova with Neutron, and
a quota limit is exceeded in Neutron, the exception from
the Neutron client results in Nova generating a 500 error.
This is unhelpful to user, and not consistent with nova-networking
Return FloatingIPExceedLimit exception when quota exceeded.

Change I8788993578ac872da9f676fe3e2fb8f98414289d at neutronclient
add OverQuotaClient exception and it is used in this patch

Change-Id: Ieb90521cf231acae8b5a9920acf6c77f2e34ef67
Closes-Bug: #1210598
Closes-Bug: #1301117

How do you handle modules that are stdlib for Python 2.7, but third-party for Python 2.6?  I believe two examples found within the Nova code base are argparse and importlib.

commit_message:
Fix and gate on H305 and H307

Both H305 and H307 are part of the OpenStack style guide.

Ensure that there are 3 groups of imports, stdlib,
third-party and project specific. Within each category
ensure that imports are in alphabetical order.

Change-Id: Id4994551c135c3c1a4982153f0c6cacba6176b95

subject: Remove unused instance variables from HostState

@Matt:  We do use this field at Rackspace.  

But unless there's in-tree code using this I think it makes more sense for downstream consumers to roll this into their own patches.  Though of course my preference would be to get that code upstreamed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 15:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Agreeing what Markmc is saying.'}, {'account_id': 8430, 'date': '2014-07-11 18:32:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I didn't see num_proj_ or any reference to proj for that matter so I must be missing that one.  I agree num_instances reference is odd, but I think it is used by NumInstancesFilter.  It's also part of _repr_ which in theory could be used by Openstack or downstream for debugging purposes.  For those reasons I'm hesitant to remove it at this point.  

I'm running through local testing of the others and we can see if this is more suitable (and start working on my own internal patch)."}, {'account_id': 8430, 'date': '2014-07-11 20:47:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-11 20:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove unused instance variables from HostState

The request was to fix num_instances_by_project in HostState to
correctly report state even when last VM was deleted.

However in investigation I discovered this instance variable isn't
used in openstack code.  Following policy, we should be removing this
code.  Also removed vm_states, task_states and
num_instances_by_os_type.

Change-Id: I4ba30a9c0639803d19d5e8355f5bc8dd3f543671
Closes-Bug: 1201379

commit_message:
Standardization of nova.image.API.download

Brings the wacky download method into the new nova.image.API object and
removes calls to nova.image.glance throughout the virt drivers that were
using various call signatures of glance.ImageService.download. Since
some of the wrapper objects that fetched image bits from Glance were
using the get and update methods of the former
nova.image.glance.GlanceImageService object, those calls were updated to
instead call the new, standardized nova.image.API methods of the same
name and call signature.

The final patch in this series will refactor the remaining direct use of
the nova.image.glance module, which are calls to
glance.generate_image_url() and glance.generate_glance_url().

Change-Id: Ib3a85d0875c06c4e54e4211bc2fb8ce3fe16161d
Partially-implements blueprint: standardize-nova-image

commit_message:
Catch InvalidAggregateAction when deleting an aggregate

When an aggregate with 'host' attribute not empty is deleted,
InvalidAggregateAction exception will be raised, but this exception
is not handled.

Closes-Bug: #1303591
Change-Id: I4ef0c4a6008acea7e9769e93de79451cfbc0a0fa

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-04 13:02:22.000000000', 'message': "Nova-api service throws error when SIGHUP is sent

Added reset method in WSGIService class.

After adding reset method when SIGHUP signal is sent to
wsgi service parent process,then it sends SIGHUP signal
to all of its child processes. Each child process handles
SIGHUP signal by first stopping the service and then calls
service start method again. When it stops the service, it
kills the eventlet thread, which internally closes the wsgi
server socket object. This server socket object is now not
usable again and it throws following error, while restarting
the service:

error: [Errno 9] Bad file descriptor

To resolve 'Bad file descriptor' error, creating duplicate
socket object, every time service starts.

When the wsgi service is stopped, it sets the green pool
size to 0, so resizing the green pool to default value,
on service restart.

Closes-Bug: #1334651

Change-Id: If1035deaf8b31f2712d88f0112fdd2e9e9dc7cb0
"}, {'created': '2014-07-09 07:00:42.000000000', 'message': "Nova-api service throws error when SIGHUP is sent

Added reset method in WSGIService class.

After adding reset method when SIGHUP signal is sent to
wsgi service parent process,then it sends SIGHUP signal
to all of its child processes. Each child process handles
SIGHUP signal by first stopping the service and then calls
service start method again. When it stops the service, it
kills the eventlet thread, which internally closes the wsgi
server socket object. This server socket object is now not
usable again and it throws following error, while restarting
the service:

error: [Errno 9] Bad file descriptor

To resolve 'Bad file descriptor' error, creating duplicate
socket object, every time service starts.

When the wsgi service is stopped, it sets the green pool
size to 0, so resizing the green pool to default value,
on service restart.

Closes-Bug: #1334651

Change-Id: If1035deaf8b31f2712d88f0112fdd2e9e9dc7cb0
"}, {'created': '2014-07-14 06:04:51.000000000', 'message': "Nova-api service throws error when SIGHUP is sent

After adding reset method when SIGHUP signal is sent to

kills the eventlet thread, which internally closes the wsgi
server socket object. This server socket object is now not
usable again and it throws following error, while restarting
the service:

error: [Errno 9] Bad file descriptor

To resolve 'Bad file descriptor' error, creating duplicate
socket object, every time service starts.

When the wsgi service is stopped, it sets the green pool
size to 0, so resizing the green pool to default value,
on service restart.

Closes-Bug: #1334651

Change-Id: If1035deaf8b31f2712d88f0112fdd2e9e9dc7cb0
"}]
commit_message:
Nova-api service throws error when SIGHUP is sent

Added reset method in WSGIService class.

After adding reset method when SIGHUP signal is sent to
wsgi service parent process,then it sends SIGHUP signal
to all of its child processes. Each child process handles
SIGHUP signal by first stopping the service and then calls
service start method again. When it stops the service, it
kills the eventlet thread, which internally closes the wsgi
server socket object. This server socket object is now not
usable again and it throws following error, while restarting
the service:

error: [Errno 9] Bad file descriptor

To resolve 'Bad file descriptor' error, creating duplicate
socket object, every time service starts.

When the wsgi service is stopped, it sets the green pool
size to 0, so resizing the green pool to default value,
on service restart.

Closes-Bug: #1334651

Change-Id: If1035deaf8b31f2712d88f0112fdd2e9e9dc7cb0

[{'created': '2014-07-14 04:15:52.000000000', 'message': "Enable terminate for EC2 InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior

The EC2 API supports an instance attribute called
InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior (IISB) which can be set to
'stop' or 'terminate' (default: 'stop').  When the instance
initiates its own shutdown, this determines whether or not
the instance hangs around in the Shutoff state or is
terminated by the system.

In nova, this is handled by the shutdown_terminate boolean.
IISB = stop      => shutdown_terminate = False
IISB = terminate => shutdown_terminate = True

sync_instance_power_state now invokes compute_api.delete if
shutdown_terminate = True and we detect the instance power state
has gone from Running to Shutdown.

Closes-bug #1131395
Change-Id: I5d420a2bf9be77583f8afb97feb761406972f67a
"}]
commit_message:
Enable terminate for EC2 InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior

The EC2 API supports an instance attribute called
InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior (IISB) which can be set to
'stop' or 'terminate' (default: 'stop').  When the instance
initiates its own shutdown, this determines whether or not
the instance hangs around in the Shutoff state or is
terminated by the system.

In nova, this is handled by the shutdown_terminate boolean.
IISB = stop      => shutdown_terminate = False
IISB = terminate => shutdown_terminate = True

sync_instance_power_state now invokes compute_api.delete if
shutdown_terminate = True and we detect the instance power state
has gone from Running to Shutdown.

Closes-bug #1131395
Change-Id: I5d420a2bf9be77583f8afb97feb761406972f67a

commit_message:
Remove cell api overrides for lock and unlock

This isn't actually needed as these methods handle objects and is
triggered when the instance object is saved.
It actually caused a race condition with unlock as it triggers 2
instance updates from a compute cell.

Change-Id: I42eea6a2984f70527d4fc37f48ad973a2248721c
Closes-Bug: #1257168

commit_message:
Move injected_network_template config to where it's used

The config is used by netutils, so netutils should be the place where it's
defined.

Change-Id: I8ec317481dc7da299225ac605f90b146e7a6d98b

[{'created': '2014-07-04 06:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add V2 tenant user manager tests

The cross over between the tenant manager and the user manager is not
tested. As this will be changed soon re-enforce the current behaviour.

Change-Id: Ia13a24dc0632d3fb0a5b127538117872a7dc660d
'}]
commit_message:
Add V2 tenant user manager tests

The cross over between the tenant manager and the user manager is not
tested. As this will be changed soon re-enforce the current behaviour.

Change-Id: Ia13a24dc0632d3fb0a5b127538117872a7dc660d

commit_message:
Pass user and roles manager to tenant manager

This is part of breaking a cyclical dependency where the client has a
reference to the manager but the manager has a reference to the client.

To be able to pass in an adapter to the managers we need to remove the
client specific usages of manager, including referring to other managers
via the client.

Change-Id: Ie238dda046ec8bbdaca749a691df3da63f5a9a63

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-11 15:53:16.000000000', 'message': 'Update the configuration docs for the revocation extension

There was a formatting error in how step 1 appeared, and I also
changed the title to the more formal name instead of OS-REVOKE,
as the other extensions did not use their OS-* name.

Change-Id: I658ac8dc61d6a8cdacb243a10d853cf9f6aa9409
'}]
commit_message:
Update the configuration docs for the revocation extension

There was a formatting error in how step 1 appeared, and I also
changed the title to the more formal name instead of OS-REVOKE,
as the other extensions did not use their OS-* name.

Change-Id: I658ac8dc61d6a8cdacb243a10d853cf9f6aa9409

commit_message:
Basic cleanup and edits for ch15

Cleaned up wording and use of sections. Provided some more clarity around
the introduction and some of the cipher options.

Change-Id: I78a961c06987a8c415d248469868dd571c1484a2
