I updated the base review with a link to https://github.com/stackforge/refstack/tree/master/defcore/havana where they have the capabilities defined in a JSON file.

My understanding is that these are literally tempest tests, but I'm not familiar enough with tempest to know what all of the tests actually mean.

I had 0 for compute-auth because I thought auth was something we wanted keystone doing, but that's just a guess and I don't have a strong opinion on that."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-06-23 13:34:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

If I understand the liked JSON correctly, compute-auth seems to rely on a negative test about accessing metadata server data from other accounts. I personally think the metadata server should die, so I'm fine with '0' here... but YMMV"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2014-06-24 12:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-24 12:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-24 12:58:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/22/100722/3/check/noop/29b82a2 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-06-26 15:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2014-07-01 19:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I honestly don't know how to vote on this and the dependent patch with the original scoring spreadsheet. My feeling is that the technical committee is being asked to make a decision on things that frankly are not technical in nature -- i.e. they are all about whether some company can call its product "Powered by OpenStack" if they don't want to include Swift (or Neutron or whatever) in their product.

How exactly this is a question for the TC still escapes me, despite the fact that I have read and re-read the ML discussions around this about ten times.

These companies that want to say they are "OpenStack, but not OpenStack", or that they are "OpenStack, but better than OpenStack", need to address the elephants in the room and just ask the community direct questions like "If I have a cloud that runs all upstream OpenStack components, but not Swift, but I run a Swift API-compatible service on some extra-special-thing, can I call my cloud 'Powered by openStack'".

Enough of this silliness around designated sections, IMO. The TC is just being asked to be a scapegoat for, frankly, a non-technical issue.

Best,

-jay'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-01 19:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Verified

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-01 19:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/22/100722/3/check/noop/003ceb8 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-07-02 10:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Jay: this review is *not* about designated sections, though. 

Capabilities scoring is just answering the question of whether we (the TC) care about a specific API, or if it's on its way to be replaced/deprecated. That's why most lines have a "1" on them.

I really think it's fair for us to express that. It's just one of the metrics that Defcore will use to score capabilities, they decide which coefficient to apply to it, they decide which score is the "bottom" score. We don't endorse replacement of part of our work here, we just express how much an API is in our future plans. I think that's a completely valid question for us to answer.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2014-07-02 20:24:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That's right, Thierry. These questions are about whether we anticipate deprecating features/APIs, whether current implementations are considered stable enough to support long term, etc. Regardless of how the designated section discussion turns out, we want to answer these questions about the capabilities because we want to help the Board understand how to *not* put technical constraints on the project by requiring us to support something we wouldn't otherwise support."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2014-07-02 20:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2014-07-06 17:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-06 17:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Verified

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-06 17:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- noop http://logs.openstack.org/22/100722/3/check/noop/19dc855 : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2014-07-07 04:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

(2 comments)

Yeah, honestly, I'm still confused what this "TC Future direction" column is supposed to be saying.

Perhaps it's just because I am so sour on the whole DefCore conversation (and the lack of addressing the elephants in the room), but I'm just befuddled what a vote on this actually means.

Sorry, I guess I'm just not bright enough to understand what the use of this is. :(

-jay'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2014-07-07 10:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Frankly, this is not a complex question or a policy question. We are being asked to answer 3 technical questions for each capability:

- "Complete": 0 if the capability test is configuration-specific, 1 otherwise

- "Stable": 0 if the capability has been there for less than 2 releases, 0 otherwise

- "Future direction": 0 if we plan to deprecate that feature in the near future, 1 otherwise

For reference see http://robhirschfeld.com/2014/05/01/defcore-capabilities-selection/

Hope this clarifies...'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2014-07-07 14:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Paul,

I wonder if a simpler solution would be to have Cinder send a notification to Nove (similar to how Neutron does) when a volume has been extended. That way, we wouldn't need to add (yet another) API extension that just muddles the public compute API even further.

It would also mean that the solution would not be hypervisor-specific.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-13 02:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

commit_message:
Enable online extend of in-use Cinder volumes

Online volume extend allows volumes that are attached to instances (in-use)
to be extended without first detaching them. This spec defines a Nova
extension that is required by Cinder to issue an online volume extend,
specifically this requires iSCSI rescan and the ability to return the size of
the volume block device from the compute host that the instance is running on.

Change-Id: I1c4224161566fdb3fc13048057c2b4726c8c83f0

commit_message:
Expose user and project in metadata services

Proposal to add new metadata fields to the existing nova metadata
services that are related to the individual user who has requested
creation of that compute resource (this could be a user or heat or
other service acting on-behalf of some user).

Part of blueprint user-project-metadata

Change-Id: I211e439407055e0f9bd1e8d564b216ad003c85e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-04-22 13:51:00.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor virt driver capabilities to support inheretence

Currently the capabilities dict in the generic virt driver is
over-written by each driver as required (or left unchanged).

his is problematic when new capabilities are added with what should
be a common default for most drivers, esp for an external driver class
such as Ironic.  This BP proposes a simple refactor to provide
inheritance for the capabilities dict.

Although a simple change to implement it has an effect on all
driver development going forwards and hence seems worth of capturing
as a blueprint.

Change-Id: Ibe479d405f8f3bf395bca357ed7373ad459eb750
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor virt driver capabilities to support inheretence

Currently the capabilities dict in the generic virt driver is
over-written by each driver as required (or left unchanged).

his is problematic when new capabilities are added with what should
be a common default for most drivers, esp for an external driver class
such as Ironic.  This BP proposes a simple refactor to provide
inheritance for the capabilities dict.

Although a simple change to implement it has an effect on all
driver development going forwards and hence seems worth of capturing
as a blueprint.

Change-Id: Ibe479d405f8f3bf395bca357ed7373ad459eb750

commit_message:
Update 'Create Volume' button with ajax

This patch set makes button 'Create Volume (Quota Exceeded)'
be replaced with enabled button 'Create Volume' after
deleting a volume.

Closes-Bug: #1326589

Change-Id: I10ebc668f99ed3f502be07cb82759052a29654a1

fixed.

commit_message:
Add keystone control exchange

This patch adds
1) Notification exchange for keystone
2) Abbility to profile keystone

In future we are going to add as well keystone
audit notification pluging

Change-Id: I21f78698431ef9da9ddf5771a0594e5ab7f755a5

commit_message:
Fix availability zone client in compute admin test

In /tempest/api/compute/admin/test_availability_zone.py file,
V3 test class use the V2 Availability Zone client.

This patch correct the client for V2 and V3 by instantiating the
correct one in base class.

Change-Id: I97903b1ea7faa02c5880c091a166e386295de0da

(4 comments)

Hi David,

Thanks for this spec, that error is definitely annoying and I'm eager to have something like this added to Ironic.

I think this spec is very good explaining the problem, but I think we need to tell a bit more about what is the solution being proposed here (afaiui that's why we need a spec and not a bug ticket) so I'm -1 because of this. I think we should say what kind of retry mechanism we implementing here, is it a retry of fixed number of attempts with a fixed interval between them? exponential backoff?... Also once the mechanism is decided we need to tell what configuration options are going to be added and their default values.

Other than that it LGTM and I will keep an eye on this spec cause I think this is a very good addition to Ironic.

Thanks David."}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2014-07-14 15:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-14 15:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2014-07-14 15:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

Thanks for the feedback Lucas! I think I covered your points. Let me know if there are still questions.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-14 15:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

Build succeeded.

- gate-ironic-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/96/103996/6/check/gate-ironic-specs-python27/60e9900 : SUCCESS in 1m 28s
- gate-ironic-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/96/103996/6/check/gate-ironic-specs-docs/d49574d/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 31s'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2014-07-14 16:10:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Thank you for brining it up. That's a long-standing pain.

My opinion on this is that we should have this feature enabled by default, to avoid throwing NodeLocked errors on a user for even short background operations.

I also don't particularly like, that we're going to deliberately use different configurations for tempest (retry enabled) and for production (retry disabled, unless we teach all users to enable it). For example, if we introduce too many background tasks, it won't affect tests (provided tasks are short enough), but will give a lot of NodeLocked for users.

To me, showing NodeLocked for a short background task means exposing too much of internal details to a user. It will teach a user to always retry without thinking.

Please let me know what you think."}, {'account_id': 3099, 'date': '2014-07-14 16:33:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Dmitry,

Excellent point about using different values for testing vs. production. I have no problem with changing the default values, but I wonder how others (not just ironic devs, but operators too) will view changing the default behavior?

Would love more feedback on this.  :)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2014-07-14 16:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

commit_message:
Add support for retry on NodeLocked exceptions

An attempt to help mitigate the problem errors due to a node being
locked by multiple threads.

Change-Id: Ib37e6a86650698bc763281ddafbab65bf80d2bdc

I'm on the fence on this one - I can see why we want to get rid of the inconsistency, but OTOH it feels wrong that Nova is deleting an object that belongs to another system. Isn't this really a use case that belongs at a higher layer (like Heat) outside of Nova ?

I think the option for delete on termination when booting an instance is a hang over from the original boot from volume work where Nova would create a new (in effect ephemeral) volume from an image in Glance.  I'm not sure that use case really exist anymore - but even if it does it doesn't seem like it should be extended to more general cases.

-1 for now until others have had their say"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-02 23:34:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2014-06-13 14:13:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Agree with the comments here, this needs a little updating before we can merge this.

But I do like the overall idea, it makes sense.

To echo chris's point, I think you need to be clearer that only admins and the user with the lock can unlock something that is app_locked, ie another app with the same role cann't unlock that server.

Need to double check we record the user and not just the role of the locker in the DB, I can't remember off the top of my head."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-06-13 14:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/78/90678/2/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/729cab4 : FAILURE in 1m 03s
- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/78/90678/2/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/0903593/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 35s'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2014-06-13 15:18:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Chris:

> why alternatives like Trove just owning the instances directly aren't suitable

Having instances just owned by Trove is a lot simpler, but when you look into the security model having everyone's database instances all owned by a single user is pretty horrible - and causes real problems if you want to integrate them with the user's Neutron network etc.   So the proposal here is to create the mechanism where a service like Trove can create instances on behalf of the user, and prevent the user from doing anything really horrible to it by accident."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2014-07-16 09:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Sorry, this blueprint has missed the Juno spec approval freeze 10 July:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-July/039259.html
Please consider re-submitting when we open nova-specs for the K release.
If you are wanting an exception, please raise this in the next nova-meeting.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2014-07-16 09:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix use of novaclient.exceptions.NotFound

test_instances was passing code=404 to NotFound's constructor, which
does not take a named code parameter.

Change-Id: I9235abe3a568bcdac7539cbfb716500b45abec3b

commit_message:
Revert "Fix failing unit tests"

Nova-team already reverted commits, which change exceptions in novaclient
whithout backward compatibility, so we should revert our local fix, which
adapted usage of exceptions for novaclient v 2.18.0 .

This reverts commit 895f3cbc55be0cce2b831093610e5addb3c50f58.

Change-Id: I728a434d2578a7148569eb7be459709fa47a73d4

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2014-04-18 21:27:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I don't believe hacking nova configuration option values is the appropriate way to solve this problem. Instead, I believe that there should be a separate "prescheduler" (really, a pre-balancer) service that lives in the space currently unfortunately called an API Cell, and distributes incoming launch server requests to different availability zones or regions.

The problem we have is that the API cells work is not generic enough to consider availability zones or full regions, since Nova and Nova cells doesn't have a native concept of a generic container of compute resources.

See here for a manifestation of that main problem:

https://www.mail-archive.com/openstack-dev@lists.openstack.org/msg20438.html'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-04-18 21:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-04-25 07:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2014-04-25 07:43:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Hi Jay,
thanks for your comments.

The "prescheduler" service concept is really interesting and challenging (balancing between regions...) however for simpler deployments I don't see the need to run a new service. 

What is proposed in this BP is to define a list of default_schedule_zones instead only one. I don't believe is hacking nova configuration options but instead extend the functionality. If a deployment has several avzs having only one default schedule zone causes several problems to balance avzs utilization today.

In this case the "availabilityzonefilter" will be aware of the different default_schedule_zones defined and the scheduler will consider all nodes in them.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-04-25 08:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/98/87098/2/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/a5b6a40 : SUCCESS in 26s
- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/98/87098/2/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/baf7b03/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 05s
'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2014-04-25 10:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I'm not convinced you're approaching the problem from the right direction.   If instead of considering it an issue of having a list of defaults you look at it as "under some circumstances I want to be able to exclude some AZs", and design a mechanism to allow that, then the default behaviour when no AZ is specified of being "Any available AZ" would exclude by definition those that are excluded for some other reason.    That seems to be a much more general solution that just not including them in the default list.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2014-05-05 16:43:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Agreed with Phil's comment. I don't see the use case for changing this stuff in nova.conf configuration options. This is more the purview of cells IMO"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-05-05 16:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

commit_message:
Define multiple default schedule zones

This blueprint implements possibility to have multiple schedule
availability zones as default, instead only one.

blueprint schedule-set-availability-zones

Change-Id: I45a5f7cb1a72ce5d9ace21f142086df4b50868d3

- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/58/98058/2/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/3bfb226/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 10s'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-06-05 09:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7698, 'date': '2014-06-05 09:45:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Horizon is not the only client that has the issue as it all gets the information via API which returns physical CPU numbers with name vcpus. I also don't think there's a way to fix it in Horizon with the currently available data via the API as there's no API for getting 'cpu_allocation_ratio'. Usually clients use 'vcpus' and 'vcpus_used' to show how many is available and how many actually used.

Regarding multiple cpu_allocation_ratio, I'm not sure how it is going to be identify situation A from situation B which has different cpu_allocation_ratio in one host as there's no API to specify the session so far. If it becomes available, we would use the same information to retrieve the right cpu_allocation_ratio also."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-16 09:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

Starting check jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2014-07-16 09:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-05 08:27:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix vcpus output in 'nova hypervisor-stats'

Currently, 'vcpus' field in 'nova hypervisor-stats' and vcpus
in horizon shows physical CPU number instead of vCPUs available
in the system that should do reflect 'cpu_allocation_ratio'.
$ grep "cpu_allocation_ratio" /etc/nova/nova.conf
cpu_allocation_ratio=16.0

commit_message:
Fix vcpus output in 'nova hypervisor-stats'

Currently, 'vcpus' field in 'nova hypervisor-stats' and vcpus
in horizon shows physical CPU number instead of vCPUs available
in the system that should do reflect 'cpu_allocation_ratio'.
$ grep "cpu_allocation_ratio" /etc/nova/nova.conf
cpu_allocation_ratio=16.0
$ cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep processor |wc -l
8
$ nova hypervisor-stats | grep "vcpus "
| vcpus                | 8     |
It shows 8 for vcpus even though cpu_allocation_ratio is 16.0.
With this patches, nova client can get the right value that should
be '128' in the above case.

Change-Id: I75258ad5e843bc6febeacfaf43a17e253438bc60

I think it's important to capture here that Resource Pool is a more fundamental concept than a cluster as far as resource scheduling goes. The use of a cluster name really just means 'use the top most resource pool in a cluster' the use of a host name really just means 'use the top most resource pool in a host' ... and this idea of resource pools interacts with Nova in interesting ways. The idea could be useful in introducing the concepts of contiguous and fragmented resources."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2014-06-03 22:08:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Propose: VMware enabling resource pool for VCenter

Take advantage of the resource pool in VCenter as the target, where
a VM can be deployed.

Related to blueprint vmware-resource-pool-enablement

Change-Id: I10143f2c65e198885bb824368cac8d50dfb38d16

commit_message:
Move auth config from api-paste.ini to nova.conf.

In Icehouse, the configurations for keystone auth token has been moved
to nova.conf. So we need to remove the configurations from api-paste.ini
and move them to nova.conf.

Change-Id: I5b5b32b16c8e9235103bd61f3c3eb1774b093e0a
Closes-Bug: #1342002

We MUST test production scenarios.

However, this is _dev_ test. We also want developers who lack access to 96G RAM boxes to be able to get started.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2014-07-14 21:39:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

i guess i'm only +1. 

i'm just not sure I see the point of a revert. It's overrideable, and that makes me happy enough. Why should COMPUTESCALE be 2 and not 1, or 3? Why should NODE_CNT be *15*? It just seems there isn't concensus around what the default devtest should actually be.

As long as these things remain configurable, I'm happy enough."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2014-07-14 21:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Putting a -2 here to hold it while we discuss.

My take on this: This setting affects defaults, not capabilities - we want the defaults to be production sane, and non-HA is not production sane. Adding some prose about how to get a one-node control plane for developers would make sense to me, but changing the default much less so.'}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2014-07-14 21:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

What if we add a warning at the start of our devtest docs on requirements for defaults settings and a notice that for setups with <20GB RAM here are a couple settings we highly recommend adjusting? The two I can think of are the env vars for *SCALE and also building directly from seed.

My thinking with why a default CONTROLSCALE of 3 makes sense is that its similar to the skip undercloud feature we support - It does not make sense for any normal deployment and only exists to support people who have a memory / build time restriction. Similarly, controlscale of 1 seems like a special case for people who are memory restricted. IMO these users should the be ones to modify their configuration, not the users who can run our recommended setup.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-14 22:38:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2014-07-14 19:50:57.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Set default OVERCLOUD_CONTROLSCALE to 3"

This reverts commit f6dd7fefca2ac7a9ac1ec6394a7e5763b8104b42.

Having our default set to one is reasonable for developers (who
generally have more limited resources).

This does not prevent CI or developers who have extra resources
from testing multi-controller deployments however.

We spoke about this in Atlanta and there was not concensus
that setting the "Dev" test scripts default to 3 was a good
idea.

commit_message:
Revert "Set default OVERCLOUD_CONTROLSCALE to 3"

This reverts commit f6dd7fefca2ac7a9ac1ec6394a7e5763b8104b42.

Having our default set to one is reasonable for developers (who
generally have more limited resources).

This does not prevent CI or developers who have extra resources
from testing multi-controller deployments however.

We spoke about this in Atlanta and there was not a concensus
as to what our default should be.

Change-Id: Ib362bf3b68f95500d961c6fdcc97619f9408dc8a

commit_message:
Spec for Hyper-V soft reboot

This blueprint introduces soft reboot support in the Nova Hyper-V driver.

bp hyper-v-soft-reboot

Change-Id: I5e22bdacdfed2918a6e45fa0aafac1810150f2d9

commit_message:
Do not show quota of removed volume types in Default Quotas panel

Fixes the issue where quota for removed volume types still show up
in Admin -> Defaults -> Default Quotas view.

Change-Id: I2a822ac08b8347a8d76e8de70deca0e34fafe6e3
Closes-Bug: #1266906

commit_message:
add a test for UnboundLocalError in linuxbridge plugin

This error occured when there are no vlan_ranges given to the
sync_network_states, but the database contains network states.

The related bug is already fixed, so this change adds a
regression test.

Related-Bug: #1308421
Change-Id: I1779fedc999044e0ca3be7d4413531ed5d69835e

commit_message:
Log swift errors to stderr

This will help us debug why files aren't being fetched from swift.

Change-Id: I94b765e18d4a8a29dfd545d0e80bb8fcf5e5d99c

commit_message:
Correct RE that validates vCenter cluster names

- match cluster names that include metachars (!@#$%^&*()_+{}:"<>?)
  e.g. 'cluster No.42'
- right now cluster names with comma are not supported
- adjust message a little, while here

Change-Id: Ic36e70ff0d0bc7bd3d23ce9cc633cec6a18df581
Closes-Bug: 1340886

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2014-07-15 09:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

As yet another option for new oslo.config API ... you could do something like

  def describe_opt_values(self):
      def sanitize(...)
          ...

      values = {}

      for opt_name in ...:
          opt = ...
          values[None] = _sanitize(getattr(self, opt_name))

      for group_name in ...:
          group_attr = ...
          for opt_name in ...:
              opt = ...
              values[group_name] = _sanitize(getattr(group_attr, opt_name))

      return values'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2014-07-15 09:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Oh, and of course ... ConfigOpts.log_opt_values() would just use describe_opt_values()'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2014-07-15 13:15:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Mark - thanks for your detailed comments, I'll address."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2014-07-15 14:01:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2014-07-16 08:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Extension to provide Read-Only REST API access to config

Limiations:

This is currently a work in progress, and does not yet support
filtering by individual option, but does support filtering by
group.

Implements blueprint configuration-rest-api

Change-Id: I0584f54d90796552c70eaa809e498789e18163be

commit_message:

commit_message:
export HOSTIP

devtest_testenv.sh is now expecting this to be set, the default
works on local devtest runs but now CI.

Change-Id: I0180e40bce2d96e9119403332970af96006afe5b

[{'created': '2014-07-15 11:22:21.000000000', 'message': "fuel-upgrade: add versions yaml hook

OpenStack Patching was introduced in Fuel 5.1, so we need to install
centos-versions.yaml and ubuntu-versiosn.yaml for Fuel 5.0.

This files are required since it's a solution of making rollback feature
when we need to install more earlier packages.

Implements blueprint upgrade-to-5-1

Change-Id: I8c3c9d50882a2f2d8aa6d43dc409fa5de110fdc2
Closes-Bug: #1341500
"}]
commit_message:
fuel-upgrade: add versions yaml hook

OpenStack Patching was introduced in Fuel 5.1, so we need to install
centos-versions.yaml and ubuntu-versiosn.yaml for Fuel 5.0.

This files are required since it's a solution of making rollback feature
when we need to install more earlier packages.

Implements blueprint upgrade-to-5-1

Change-Id: I8c3c9d50882a2f2d8aa6d43dc409fa5de110fdc2
Closes-Bug: #1341500

commit_message:
LBaaS member creation enhancement

This patch set allow user to chose a source for LBaaS member:
select active instances or just specify IP address.

Implements blueprint lbaas-members

Change-Id: I60a26c085bb0c88b55685d914a23ee3b0bfb7de4

Output in such case can look like:


tempest.scenario.test_load_balancer_basic.TestLoadBalancerBasic.test_load_balancer_basic[compute,gate,network,smoke]
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Captured traceback:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "tempest/test.py", line 128, in wrapper
        return f(self, *func_args, **func_kwargs)
      File "tempest/scenario/test_load_balancer_basic.py", line 300, in test_load_balancer_basic
        self._start_servers()
      File "tempest/scenario/test_load_balancer_basic.py", line 163, in _start_servers
        username, key.name)
      File "tempest/common/commands.py", line 92, in copy_file_to_host
        proc = subprocess.Popen(args, **subprocess_args)
      File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 642, in __init__
        errread, errwrite)
      File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/subprocess.py", line 1234, in _execute_child
        raise child_exception
    TypeError: execv() argument 1 must be encoded string without NULL bytes, not str


With for ex. following being passed to copy_file_to_host:
> /tmp/tmpWZkElM /tmp/script1 172.24.4.6 cirros /tmp/tmpWUmIJ_

and then in there following 'cmd' value
> scp -v -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no -i /tmp/tmpWUmIJ_ /tmp/tmpWZkElM cirros@172.24.4.6:/tmp/script1
becoming something like this (and then passed to Popen):
> ['s\x00\x00\x00c\x00\x00\x00p\x00\x00\x00', '\x00\x00\x00-\x00\x00\x00v ... 0\x00\x00']'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-10 23:10:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-10 21:55:20.000000000', 'message': 'Always pass str to shlex.split for py26 compat

On python 2.6 shlex.split cannot handle unicode,
which can lead to TypeError exception.

Details can be seen in
http://bugs.python.org/issue6988
and
http://bugs.python.org/issue1548891

As best solution it seems to decode *cmd* to utf-8 str
before passing to shlex.split().

Change-Id: If56a6f16ab712691b26035d0cd3d7d70260a64c6
'}]
commit_message:
Always pass str to shlex.split for py26 compat

On python 2.6 shlex.split cannot handle unicode,
which can lead to TypeError exception.

Details can be seen in
http://bugs.python.org/issue6988
and
http://bugs.python.org/issue1548891

As best solution it seems to decode *cmd* to utf-8 str
before passing to shlex.split().

Change-Id: If56a6f16ab712691b26035d0cd3d7d70260a64c6

commit_message:
Added new links to the section_user-data.xml

If someone would like to click on these links to get directly to
Puppetlabs or Chef, this is the only place that it is directly
referanced.

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 13:28:45.000000000', 'message': 'Disable sshd GSSAPI auth

GSSAPI is not currently implemented in Fuel, so
it only slows incoming SSH connections. Disabling
it will enhance user experience.

Change-Id: I935e7c383e24663296c938e32b12682086d6797b
Closes-Bug: #1327988
'}]
commit_message:
Disable sshd GSSAPI auth

GSSAPI is not currently implemented in Fuel, so
it only slows incoming SSH connections. Disabling
it will enhance user experience.

Change-Id: I935e7c383e24663296c938e32b12682086d6797b
Closes-Bug: #1327988

Add CONTRIBUTING.rst

There is no CONTRIBUTING.rst file, the patch will add it.

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Send network name and uuid to subnet create

Added the network segment name and uuid parameters to the infomation sent to
Cisco N1kV during subnet creation to allow for proper association of the
subnet and network segment.

Change-Id: I375d49ec43f79360189ecf5de0583873b8039db9
Closes-Bug: 1332713

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 23:33:31.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the order of assembly deletion

If a heat stack has not been created (the case in some functional tests)
deployer.delete_heat_stack() is fast and ends up deleting the assembly
before the assembly handler has a chance to set the state to DELETING.

This patch just sets the state to DELETING before calling delete_heat_stack()
to prevent this.

Change-Id: I2ba64c02f1d797327582b93229eb980617c3a504
Closes-bug: #1342399
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the order of assembly deletion

If a heat stack has not been created (the case in some functional tests)
deployer.delete_heat_stack() is fast and ends up deleting the assembly
before the assembly handler has a chance to set the state to DELETING.

This patch just sets the state to DELETING before calling delete_heat_stack()
to prevent this.

Change-Id: I2ba64c02f1d797327582b93229eb980617c3a504
Closes-bug: #1342399

commit_message:
Remove docutils pin

This was added to work around bug 1091333.  A new sphinx has been
released and so this is no longer necessary.

Change-Id: I6ea61a3cc441dd1ca2ced7e2fd837a55b917f76d

commit_message:
Split section_networking_introduction.xml

The section_networking_introduction.xml is too long, and contains more
than introduction content, it is better to split it to make it easier to
mantain.
This patch simply split it to 3 xml files:
- The section_networking_introduction.xml contains the overview of
  networking.

- The section_networking_config-plugins.xml introduce the configuration
  about plugins.

- The section_networking_config-agents.xml introduce the configuration
  about neutron agents.

For the plugin configuration and the neutron agents configuration is not
introduction scoped, so this patch will change the documantation
structure.

Change-Id: I42d373fa7488799a0d25e073605da398c52285be
Closes-Bug: #1341342

commit_message:
Add information regarding HTTPS for SSL enabled endpoints

When using SSL the endpoint should be configured to listen on HTTPS
instead of HTTP. So the corresponding documentation has been enhanced.

Change-Id: I941a5169df291983a536eb89d87642440c54a0fc
Closes-Bug: #1317815

commit_message:
l2-pop : removing a TODO for the delete port use case

since this commit : d9bcd597c67900472709cd11604afe1616e0af4e
port info are accessible during the delete_post_commit

Change-Id: I2c560b78c59fc178e668ae73fb994f1ef4b68dc4

commit_message:
Auto-collect local checks

check_mk supports the option to add checks by dropping executables
into a known directory.

This directory varies on Debian and RHEL-based systems, therefore
this patch allows for users to place these checks into a new
top level directory in the element named "check_mk_checks".

Any script found in here will be deployed to the relevant location
on the target host as part of the image build.

Change-Id: I96312e8b23cb2ff14a19509370a1c48504d73ce8

@slagel - This patch essentially provides a "helper" function that can then be used by other elements to create a database as part of install/configuration.

I'm thinking particularly of systems such as Icinga-Web or Exim where you might want a database backend in place *before* you install the package so that any arguments given to dpkg-config or yum can be applied immediately on installation.

If this is the "wrong" approach then I'm happy to find the "right" one, however if you could provide some guidance on what this might be then that would be great! :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-09 13:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Verified

From IRC:

13:34 < slagle> proffalken: ok, this is confusing me then: "I'm thinking particularly of systems such as Icinga-Web or Exim where you might want a database backend in place *before* you install the 
                package so that any arguments given to dpkg-config or yum can be applied immediately on installation."
13:34 < proffalken> bad wording on my part
13:34 < proffalken> install != configure
13:34 < proffalken> it's been a long few weeks
13:35 < proffalken> The use case that sparked this is as follows:
13:35 < proffalken> 1) Some packages require a database to be in place before they can be configured
13:35 < proffalken> 2) Therefore we need to be able to create that database before we configure the software
13:36 < proffalken> 3) It would be nice to configure the database in a standard, shared and structured manner across all packages that require it
13:36 < proffalken> 4) HEAT works well across all packages for configuration management, let's use that to create the database
13:36 < proffalken> (or something like that anyway)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-09 13:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

It seems like this is very much a trove-like feature ('give me a DB via an API') - and for that we've got a thing - Trove - what we need to do is enable its use for the desired scenario. Bootstrap issues aside, it would be nice to use Trove for our DB's too! AIUI this is about supporting additional services within the cluster - icinga, exim - and in reality as we add e.g. Trove itself we'll want DB's for them. OTOH our goal here should be to get regular VM facilities up as quickly as we can, because then we can use Trove and share in the common love there rather than having a parallel infrastructure in place. The multi-hypervisor spec will allow us to deploy containers or VMs in the deploy cloud - which means we could have a deploy cloud with Trove baked in, and then deploy exim and icinga in containers on the deploy cloud, backed by Trove deploy instances also in containers/VMs - and thereby keep the set of things we need to develop dynamic answers for to a minimum (specifically the transitive closure of 'the API for $thing' - where we need $thing to be networking, machines, authentication and apparently DB's.) The big difference between the deploy cloud and the workload cloud is that the workload cloud deployment can consume all those APIs, whereas the deploy cloud has to bootstrap them."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-14 14:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

commit_message:
Add the ability to create databases from within Elements

This patch provides a script to create MySQL databases from the
heat metadata "mysql.databases".

The README has been updated to show an example of how this might
be used.

NOTE: The ability to assign users to databases via HEAT has been
retained to ensure backwards compatibility, however this should
probably be seen as a deprecated feature once this patch has
merged.

Change-Id: Ib64001780bfe0f18a47653421372f64634ac7280

[{'created': '2014-06-25 06:12:02.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Make nwfilter driver use right filterref

This fixes Bug #1220856 which occurs with Libvirt NWFilterFirewall
Driver.  While creating a VM with multiple NICs including one connects
to DHCP serving network and another to DHCP non-serving network,
NWFilterFirewall Driver will use the same base filter that allows DHCP
for all NICs. This leads a libvirt launch error due to lack of
'dhcp_server' parameter which is needed to define allow-DHCP filters.

This patch makes NWFilterFirewall Driver use right base filter for

commit_message:
libvirt: Make nwfilter driver use right filterref

This fixes Bug #1220856 which occurs with Libvirt NWFilterFirewall
Driver.  While creating a VM with multiple NICs including one connects
to DHCP serving network and another to DHCP non-serving network,
NWFilterFirewall Driver will use the same base filter that allows DHCP
for all NICs. This leads a libvirt launch error due to lack of
'dhcp_server' parameter which is needed to define allow-DHCP filters.

This patch makes NWFilterFirewall Driver use right base filter for
each NIC depends on 'dhcp_server' config.

Closes-bug: #1220856
Change-Id: I7f9a7c281f152985478b2ec295f0644ba475fd76
(cherry picked from commit d2874463010b129e62a568357cfa1df3ab4805e6)

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-15 18:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

[{'created': '2014-07-13 10:15:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add volume driver for Huawei 18000 storage system

Huawei OceanStor 18000-series enterprise storage system is an optimum
storage platform for next-generation data centers that feature
virtualization, hybrid cloud, simplified IT, and low carbon footprints.

This patch add an iSCSI driver and a FC driver for Huawei 18000 storage
system, using REST. We define a common module for both iSCSI driver and
FC driver.

commit_message:
Add volume driver for Huawei 18000 storage system

Huawei OceanStor 18000-series enterprise storage system is an optimum
storage platform for next-generation data centers that feature
virtualization, hybrid cloud, simplified IT, and low carbon footprints.

This patch add an iSCSI driver and a FC driver for Huawei 18000 storage
system, using REST. We define a common module for both iSCSI driver and
FC driver.

Change-Id: I949d00f665fd664fadc7edb39765b8ca495d08ac
Implements: blueprint huawei-18000-driver

commit_message:
Updated assign_and_create in conductor

Adding component and stack references to a_and_c call

Closes-Bug: 1340825
Change-Id: I064f5e14cf789f9ec8f2a4d109eee5478b53de50

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 9520, 'date': '2014-02-08 04:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@flwang, I just downloaded this patchset and tested it (no modifications) - it runs fine. Here's what I did:

1. git review -d 63674

2. vim /etc/glance/glance-api.conf, modify image_property_quota (I set it to 10)

3. start glance (and other related services)

4. image-update --property k1=v1 --property k2=v2 ... --property k11=v11 - this fails with a 413 error

5. image-update --property k1=v1 --property k2=v2 ... --property k10=v10 - this succeeds

6. vim /etc/glance/glance-api.conf, modify image_property_quota (set it to 5), restart glance

8. image-update --property k1=v11 - this succeeds

9. image-update --remove-property k5 - this also succeeds

Did you set the image_property_quota in glance-api.conf to a suitable value or forget to restart the server?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-02-08 05:11:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-23 06:20:50.000000000', 'message': 'Allow some property operations when quota exceeded

Currently in Glance v2 if, for some reason, an image has more properties
than the image_propery_quota allows (e.g. the quota was lowered after the
image was created with properties) then any request to modify or delete
existing properties results in a 413 overlimit error. Ideally a user should
be able to remove properties or any other action except for adding a
property when they are over their quota for a given image.

This commit makes sure that addition of new properties after exceeding quota
is enforced but other operations still permitted.

Change-Id: Icf1b46343463791ed3d2f3ce376f11e409e792ff
Closes-bug: #1258331
'}, {'created': '2013-12-23 06:22:03.000000000', 'message': 'Allow some property operations when quota exceeded

This commit makes sure that addition of new properties after exceeding

Closes-bug: #1258331
'}, {'created': '2013-12-23 06:27:51.000000000', 'message': 'Allow some property operations when quota exceeded

Change-Id: Icf1b46343463791ed3d2f3ce376f11e409e792ff
Closes-bug: #1258331
'}, {'created': '2014-01-21 03:17:15.000000000', 'message': 'Allow some property operations when quota exceeded

Currently in Glance v2 if, for some reason, an image has more
properties than the image_propery_quota allows (e.g. the quota was
lowered after the image was created with properties) then any request
to modify or delete existing properties results in a 413 overlimit
error. Ideally a user should be able to remove properties or any other
action except for adding a property when they are over their quota for
a given image.

This commit initializes the 'extra_properties' field of quota.ImageProxy
to a new quota.ExtraPropertiesProxy class which is a subclass of
domain.ExtraProperties. Quota checks for property operations are now
performed in the __setitem__ method of this class.

As a result, the quota checking behaviour has changed. Previously, all
quota was checked "in bulk" when either the image is created or when it
is saved (i.e. an image object is first created with all properties set,
the quota checking happens when an attempt is made to write the image to
DB). But now the quota checking happens "live" as soon as a property is
added, irrespective of how many properties are to be added in total.
Therefore the original ImagePropertyLimitExceeded exception message has
also been changed because the number of properties to be set is not
known any more.

Change-Id: Icf1b46343463791ed3d2f3ce376f11e409e792ff
Closes-bug: #1258331

action except for adding a property when they are over their quota for

'}, {'created': '2014-02-17 09:08:21.000000000', 'message': 'Allow some property operations when quota exceeded

Currently in Glance v2 if, for some reason, an image has more
properties than the image_propery_quota allows (e.g. the quota was
lowered after the image was created with properties) then any request
to modify or delete existing properties results in a 413 overlimit
error. Ideally a user should be able to remove properties or any other
action except for adding a property when they are over their quota for
a given image.

This commit does this by adding a new member to the quota.ImageProxy
class to "remember" what properties were already present in an image
*before* any new property operations are preformed on the image. After
the new property operations are performed the quotas are checked (before
writing the image info to DB) only if any new properties have been
added.

This commit does not use a subclass of ExtraPropertiesProxy to check
property quotas (in the __setitem__ method) because Glance does not
implement the JSON-patch RFC correctly - in Glance all operations in a
patch are applied and the quota checked only after all operations have
been applied (RFC requires that operations be applied sequentially and
fail on the first failure). Therefore it is possible for the quota to be
temporarily exceeded when a patch is being applied and therefore we
cannot check for quotas as they are being added - we have to wait until
all patch operations have been completed.

Change-Id: Icf1b46343463791ed3d2f3ce376f11e409e792ff
Closes-bug: #1258331
Author: David Koo <david.koo@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Allow some property operations when quota exceeded

Currently in Glance v2 if, for some reason, an image has more
properties than the image_propery_quota allows (e.g. the quota was
lowered after the image was created with properties) then any request
to modify or delete existing properties results in a 413 overlimit
error. Ideally a user should be able to remove properties or any other
action except for adding a property when they are over their quota for
a given image.

This commit does this by adding a new member to the quota.ImageProxy
class to "remember" what properties were already present in an image
*before* any new property operations are preformed on the image. After
the new property operations are performed the quotas are checked (before
writing the image info to DB) only if any new properties have been
added.

This commit does not use a subclass of ExtraPropertiesProxy to check
property quotas (in the __setitem__ method) because Glance does not
implement the JSON-patch RFC correctly - in Glance all operations in a
patch are applied and the quota checked only after all operations have
been applied (RFC requires that operations be applied sequentially and
fail on the first failure). Therefore it is possible for the quota to be
temporarily exceeded when a patch is being applied and therefore we
cannot check for quotas as they are being added - we have to wait until
all patch operations have been completed.

Also, as per review discussions in IRC, a new file:
    glance/tests/integration/v2/test_property_quota_violations.py
has been added to perform image property quota related tests (because
the functional test framework is slow).

Change-Id: Icf1b46343463791ed3d2f3ce376f11e409e792ff
Closes-bug: #1258331
Author: David Koo <david.koo@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Added a Dockerfile to create Chef language pack

We need Chef language pack with chef specific
testing tools installed on it.
This patch provides a Dockerfile to create such a LP.

Implements: blueprint chef-language-pack

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/solum/+spec/chef-language-pack

Change-Id: I8d4ee18efb4ea1b144c5f4583922d09795146c27

commit_message:
Expose auth_ref in ironicclient client object

To implement token expiry in Nova's Ironic driver, we need
to expose additional information obtained from the keystone
client.

Change-Id: I14aa8aca8b83f6c9a233bb19406d03002a76f139
Partial-bug: #1308171

commit_message:
Fix error count for stack-list while show deleted

1.The count for stack-list is incorrect while show deleted.
  The count should include the deleted ones.
2.We should check the value of 'with_count', if the value
  is invalid, we should raise ValueError.

Change-Id: Ie1eef7a7ec63870ac28929bcadcd917bbc8d3203
Closes-bug: #1331383

commit_message:
Update cinder generate_sample script

Cinder's generate sample script has fallen a
bit out of date and was no longer working properly
in local venv.

This patch updates it with a working version that
reads the rc file and makes some other updates.

Even better, we'll update the tox.ini file here so
that it actually works, and finally add some more
info to the error message when update check fails
to make is obvious how to run these appropriately.

Change-Id: I2389910d8ece6f737a9609ce4aa05263d9293e14

What is the plan to ensure we do this for each release?'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2014-07-15 16:56:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Totally disagree that there is no value to having the config file changes visible in a review, and said this on the mailing list. When you're trying to track things like back-compatibility, it is by a very long way the easiest place to see the affects of a change."}, {'account_id': 8247, 'date': '2014-07-15 16:57:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Eric: Could you clarify what you mean? Do you mean how do we enforce that cinder.conf.sample is somewhat up-to-date? Or do you mean how will the doc build pick up the latest options for each release? Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2014-07-15 17:05:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

I tried this here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/96581/

Note the violent outcry :)  Seems like we can just live with it assuming we can get more people interested/willing to generate the updates when needed.'}, {'account_id': 8247, 'date': '2014-07-16 00:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Majority of people are opposed to the feature.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2014-07-16 03:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

John, Duncan's comment on your change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/96581/ was "I'd rather we continued to generate it but didn't gate on it", which is exactly what patch is trying to do - stop Cinder from gating config change.  It's just the side effect of stop gating config file change doesn't force people to update config file sample anymore when submitting patches.  On the other hand, it saves us a lot of trouble to deal with unexpected gate failure due to requirement library update implying config file change.

We still have generate_sample.sh in tools/config/ and have a 'testenv:genconfig' rule in tox.ini to generate config file sample.  People can generate config sample whenever they want.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-10 02:27:22.000000000', 'message': 'Disable check_uptodate.sh in run_tests.sh

If pbr is used to setup cinder scripts, run_tests.sh will
start failing. This is caused by check_uptodate.sh because
cinder.conf.sample does not have a matching template that
will support multiple cinder-volume backends with different
hosts. To allow run_tests.sh as well as gate to pass,
check_uptodate.sh had to be disabled in run_tests.sh.

A similar change was made in nova and heat projects. The mailing
list discussion surrounding this can be found at:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/
2014-February/026253.html. Basically, checking an auto-generated
file into git causes issues. The doc build includes a
Configuration Reference which extracts the options and
builds nicely formatted tables. Given that, there is no value in
keeping/checking the generated config file.

Change-Id: I2f61bac22daed53961d58f0b06a9e13ee16ed558
Implements: blueprint unit-test-cases-for-cinder-scripts

commit_message:
Disable check_uptodate.sh in run_tests.sh

run_tests.sh calls check_uptodate.sh to verify that
cinder.conf.sample has the most up-to-date config
settings. However, this fails from time to time, e.g.
when people forget to add in their new option. To allow
run_tests.sh as well as gate to pass, check_uptodate.sh
had to be disabled in run_tests.sh.

A similar change was made in nova and heat projects. The mailing
list discussion surrounding this can be found at:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/
2014-February/026253.html. Basically, checking an auto-generated
file into git causes issues. The doc build includes a
Configuration Reference which extracts the options and
builds nicely formatted tables. Given that, there is no value in
keeping/checking the generated config file.

Change-Id: I2f61bac22daed53961d58f0b06a9e13ee16ed558

subject: Allow deprecated decorator to specify no plan for removal

commit_message:
Allow deprecated decorator to specify no plan for removal

Allow the @deprecated decorator to specify functionality as deprecated
but not slate any release for removal of the deprecated functionality.

Change-Id: Iff24553ec83c4a8b0faf4b6381b6fe1589a1c089

Finding an IPv4 address to advertise fails and crashes if the

commit_message:
Fix no IP on interface error

Finding an IPv4 address to advertise fails and crashes if the
interface exists but has no valid IPs.  This can be fixed by
adding KeyError to the exceptions caught.

Change-Id: I60204427ec5201696d02c5c26f4b43a00d794413
Closes-Bug: #1342448

[{'created': '2014-07-11 17:30:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix backup execution workflow

This patch ensures that _run_post_backup() always runs after
the backup operation has completed (post-backup). Fixes issue
wherein any cleanup occuring in _run_post_backup would race
with commands running during backup (potentially unpredictable
dangerous situation).

Change-Id: I279c9a85415ac6ec2ddf8e564a056a3415690f68
Closes-Bug: #1340864
'}, {'created': '2014-07-11 18:33:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix backup execution workflow

This patch ensures that _run_post_backup() always runs after
the backup operation has completed (post-backup). Fixes issue
wherein any cleanup occuring in _run_post_backup would race

Change-Id: I279c9a85415ac6ec2ddf8e564a056a3415690f68

commit_message:
Fix backup execution workflow

This patch ensures that _run_post_backup() always runs after
the backup operation has completed (post-backup). Fixes issue
wherein any cleanup occuring in _run_post_backup would race
with commands running during backup (potentially unpredictable
dangerous situation).

Change-Id: I279c9a85415ac6ec2ddf8e564a056a3415690f68
Closes-Bug: #1340864

commit_message:
Move libvirt's qemu configuration dir to state fs

We need libvirt domain entries created by Nova in to persist across
image upgrades.  Otherwise, instances are effectively removed from the
hypervisor after a new image deploys with an empty libvirt config tree.
This registers /etc/libvirt/qemu as a stateful path and ensures persistent
domain configurations across upgrades.

Change-Id: I419bb25069314c7e639f980b5c236711b2d58edc
Closes-bug: #1336115

commit_message:
prefer identity API v3 over v2 in auth_token

This reverses the default order of preference between v2 and v3 to use
v3 by default if both are available.

Change-Id: I1a0a3b6c0652e7a762b51538c522e4cb1615bd39
Closes-Bug: 1336056

commit_message:
SAML2 ECP auth plugin

Auth plugin authenticating against remote SAML based Identity Providers.
Upon successful authentication the plugin retrieves and stores unscoped token.
Plugin object should be later used for scoping the token.

Currently only HTTP BasicAuth Method is supported as
an IdP authn method.

Will not work for ADFS, as that has extensions to the document formats
as well as a different workflow.

Change-Id: Ieea40505a406bedf7219fa6f9e6cf29a45ad6e88
Implements: blueprint add-saml2-cli-authentication

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-06-16 23:56:30.000000000', 'message': "Set version bounds for diskimage-builder

In an attempt to begin managing Ironic stable branches, we'll be moving our
DevStack testing toward relying on a versioned DIB dependency from pip instead
cloning and running from trunk.  This sets a version requirement to the most
recent DIB release.

Change-Id: If69963dba3cc55aa79bd0165ab147e7b3f776f75
"}]
commit_message:
Set version bounds for diskimage-builder

In an attempt to begin managing Ironic stable branches, we'll be moving our
DevStack testing toward relying on a versioned DIB dependency from pip instead
cloning and running from trunk.  This sets a version requirement to the most
recent DIB release.

Change-Id: If69963dba3cc55aa79bd0165ab147e7b3f776f75

commit_message:
Added oslosphinx theme & enabled the incubating theme

Added via -f <url> as per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Oslo#Why_aren.27t_alpha_releases_of_oslo.config_published_to_PyPI.3F

Change-Id: I4e35abd6da42a5d9a7bb8c3b56fd4e8610e4e17c

commit_message:
Add run_tests.sh to congress

This patch adds run_test.sh and includes the required files from
oslo-incubator that are needed for it.

run_tests.sh was shameless taken from neturon and renamed to congress.

Change-Id: I82a00726090e4b2eb01fd174c9e2f77a8a1e5847
Closes-bug: 1339900

commit_message:
Fix wrong test fixture for Node.properties

Currently db.utils.get_test_node() generate Node.properties with
wrong keys. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I17ea664528c121d643a55df6266ee2bb1027b171

commit_message:
New driver ManagementInterface

This blueprint will introduce a new driver interface called Management
Interface, this interface will support management operations like:
Setting the boot device, getting the current boot device and getting
the supported boot devices. Of course this is just the initial methods,
and more operations could be added in the future.

Change-Id: I96c7e8f75c67a71544958aec60c9d13fb4212b0b

@danpb:

The error with VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE is
"Migration failure: unsupported configuration: Target device address type none does not match source pci"

Interestingly enough, I discovered that after the first successful migration, and further migrations have to *NOT* remove the console element, otherwise we get
"Migration failure: unsupported configuration: Target domain console count 0 does not match source 1" (the exact opposite of the error you get if, for the first migration, you don't remove the console element).

I'm not sure what's going on here.  Any ideas?'}, {'account_id': 7677, 'date': '2014-02-26 16:37:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Knit #1: one of the benefits of extracting code into smaller methods is that you can have separate unit tests for that method and then mock it in tests of other methods that call it. You didn't do that for _correct_listen_addr() and _check_graphics_addresses_can_live_migrate(), which may have contributed to:

Knit #2: you've added 4 huge and nearly identical test methods to the already bloated test_driver.py. I understand that code quality target for unit tests is not as high as that of the user facing code, but you must understand that you are making your and other contributors life slightly harder every time you make unit tests less maintainable.

Neither problem is enough to -1, but enough for me to have reservations about giving this commit a +1."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2014-07-03 10:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-13 22:03:55.000000000', 'message': "Change listen address on libvirt live-migration

Previously, in order for libvirt live migration to work,
the graphics listen addresses (VNC and/or Spice) had to be
set on both machines to be 0.0.0.0.  This was because libvirt
would try to rebind to the source address on the destination
machine, but would fail due to the source machine already having
that address (this would not happen for 0.0.0.0, however).

Now, a modified copy of the instance's XML is passed to libvirt's
migrate function, such that the listen addresses are that of the
destination machine.  The addresses are stashed in the pre-migration
data by the destination pre-migration method.

Fixes: bug #1279563

Change-Id: I6c9500283027193179c11d18ad4242e165a9ad6e
"}, {'created': '2014-03-18 15:03:24.000000000', 'message': "Change listen address on libvirt live-migration

that address (this would not happen for 0.0.0.0, however).

Now, a modified copy of the instance's XML is passed to libvirt's
migrate function, such that the listen addresses are that of the
destination machine.  The addresses are stashed in the pre-migration
data by the destination pre-migration method.

Fixes: bug #1279563

Change-Id: I6c9500283027193179c11d18ad4242e165a9ad6e

commit_message:
Change listen address on libvirt live-migration

Previously, in order for libvirt live migration to work,
the graphics listen addresses (VNC and/or Spice) had to be
set on both machines to be 0.0.0.0 or ::.  This was because libvirt
would try to rebind to the source address on the destination
machine, but would fail due to the source machine already having
that address (this would not happen for 0.0.0.0 or ::, however).

Now, a modified copy of the instance's XML is passed to libvirt's
migrate function, such that the listen addresses are that of the
destination machine.  The addresses are stashed in the pre-migration
data by the destination pre-migration method.

Note that this functionality will only work on versions of libvirt
with the VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE flag.  If the flag is not detected
(anything vanilla libvirt less than 1.0.0), the live migration code
will fall back to the old method.

Fixes: bug #1279563

Change-Id: I6c9500283027193179c11d18ad4242e165a9ad6e

Hi Fawad,
Code changes looks straight forward to me but I am concerned about CI coverage.

I believe it is good to add sg related tempest tests into the CI. Make sure they pass. From my prior experience, I can tell that it should not be acceptable otherwise.

I shall do +1 once it is added to the coverage.'}, {'account_id': 8279, 'date': '2014-07-14 23:26:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Hi Ronak,

I completely agree with you about CI coverage and it was declared as part of blueprint. PLUMgrid CI runs list of test cases and it will be updated as soon as this code and devstack change [1] is implemented, which depends on this blueprint. I considered enabling it now but it made more sense to do once all all components are merged instead of running otherwise. Rest assured, the changes have been regressed enough to be stable. I hope that's okay with you and CI coverage for this will added as soon as this in and devstack changes are there. This requires changes in CI infra/setup, so better done on final changes to not break CI for all the other commits. 

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/devstack/+spec/plumgrid-neutron-security-groups"}, {'account_id': 7962, 'date': '2014-07-14 23:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Fawad,
I agree that mainstream plumgrid CI should not be changed without this change.

Typically, what I do at nuage is to run a special CI coverage for the new patch to show that once the patch is merged, this is the updated CI which we are expecting.

From what I understand from your reply, it seems that it is just the matter of posting private run of the CI on this patch. Can we have it available?'}, {'account_id': 8279, 'date': '2014-07-14 23:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Ronak,

Oh yes. Definitely. I can have a private run for this changeset. Let me point my system to a supported backend and trigger Jenkins. That should cover it.

Thanks,
Fawad'}, {'account_id': 7962, 'date': '2014-07-15 00:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

Alright, Thanks Fawad. 

That should set the expectation right wrt CI coverage as everyone knows this is the coverage post merge of this change. 

I hope I am not PIA :). Removing -1 since we will have new plumgrid CI run posted.'}, {'account_id': 8279, 'date': '2014-07-15 00:05:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Thanks Ronak. I actually second you on the private CI run. I should be able to have the run available very soon.'}, {'account_id': 8279, 'date': '2014-07-15 01:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Ronak,

PLUMgrid CI run with security groups enabled is there now. Also validates my future (post-merge of this change) CI work. ;)

Thanks,
Fawad'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2014-07-15 07:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2014-07-15 14:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-07-15 14:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Verified

commit_message:
Security groups extension for PLUMgrid plugin

This patch includes immplementation of security groups
extension in PLUMgrid plugin.

APIs include CRUD operations for security groups
and security group rules.

Added unit tests.

Implements: blueprint plumgrid-plugin-security-groups
Change-Id: I23fea3fe6c3abbe310e883e00706b93863db3bfb

commit_message:
ofagent: Fix an argument mismatch bug in commit 9d13ea88

recently merged commit 9d13ea884bff749b3975acb5eb5630e5aca4a665
had an argument mismatch bug which causes the following crash.

    TypeError: _get_ports() takes exactly 2 arguments (1 given)

this commit fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1336175
Change-Id: I46bb1fc1aebf06274bb226014e4a9bc5a83f98ac

commit_message:
Make sure unit tests set the correct log levels

Unit tests appear to not set the expected logging levels so
a number of modules will log excessivly (e.g. ISO8601).

This change ensures the base test classe sets the correct logging
levels (in the same way as the openstack.common.log module).

Change-Id: Ic11b7adee5f27f71094b4ef2b4a635f78f83cba8
Closes-Bug: #1340970

commit_message:
Fix the section name in CONTRIBUTING.rst

The name of the section "If you're developer, start here"
has changed in the wiki, now is "If you're a developer".
This commit updates it to correctly refer to the
proper section.

Change-Id: Ibc5899d2577187b854213690731136edd4cd74ab

commit_message:
Use jsonutils to load adapter response

This is not technically needed, however we and the libraries we use,
aren't very good about keeping our strings and bytes straight for python
3. jsonutils has an attempt to decode stage that means we can let it
manage the correct types.

commit_message:
Fix OS::Trove::Instance restore_point property

python-troveclient expects restorePoint to be a dictionary with a
"backupRef" key.

Change-Id: Ib4d83e82dcd5c012fdc12255a93682a6c2d9f47c
Closes-Bug: #1338626

[{'created': '2014-06-12 22:21:56.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure FC ZoneManager is called

This patch ensures that the FC ZoneManager
is called during image<-->volume operations.

This patch adds 2 new methods to the base
FibreChannelDriver class to handle add/remove
zone calls.  The driver creates the zonemanager
at startup and uses the zonemanager during
add_zone and remove_zone calls.

This patch also refactors out the ZoneManager
from the volume manager.  The volume manager now
calls the driver to do the add_zone and remove_zone
calls.

Change-Id: Ie3ae70785f500a140003ad3a8495e0ddc3516ea8
Closes-Bug: 1321798
'}, {'created': '2014-06-17 20:09:23.000000000', 'message': "Ensure FC ZoneManager is called

This patch ensures that the FC ZoneManager
is called during for all cases in Cinder
that does a volume attach/detach for FC
enabled drivers.

The problem was that we had code in the volume
manager that manually called the ZoneManager,
after initialize_connection and terminate_connection,
but other places in Cinder were not calling the
ZoneManager.

This patch creates 2 new decorators that can
be used for any driver's initialize_connection
and terminate_connection call.   The decorator
checks to make sure that the return value is for
a fibre_channel attachment and then calls the
ZoneManager's add_connection or delete_connection.

commit_message:
Ensure FC ZoneManager is called

This patch ensures that the FC ZoneManager
is called during for all cases in Cinder
that does a volume attach/detach for FC
enabled drivers.
The problem was that we had code in the volume
manager that manually called the ZoneManager,
after initialize_connection and terminate_connection,
but other places in Cinder were not calling the
ZoneManager.
This patch creates 2 new decorators that can
be used for any driver's initialize_connection
and terminate_connection call.   The decorator
checks to make sure that the return value is for
a fibre_channel attachment and then calls the
ZoneManager's add_connection or delete_connection.
Change-Id: Ie3ae70785f500a140003ad3a8495e0ddc3516ea8
Closes-Bug: 1321798

Previously if Ceilometer cervice was enabled, no needed
configuration option was set for Neutron to enable the network
notifications, so it was fixed.

Change-Id: Ia53d9db1828ef2daa0ce637b2a2635795856502c
Closes-Bug: #1340754
'}, {'created': '2014-07-13 13:31:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Neutron configuration if Ceilometer is enabled

Previously if Ceilometer service was enabled,
configuration option to enable Neutron network
notifications was not set. This fixes it.

Change-Id: Ia53d9db1828ef2daa0ce637b2a2635795856502c
Closes-Bug: #1340754

commit_message:
Fix Neutron configuration if Ceilometer is enabled

Previously if Ceilometer service was enabled,
configuration option to enable Neutron network
notifications was not set. This fixes it.

Change-Id: Ia53d9db1828ef2daa0ce637b2a2635795856502c
Closes-Bug: #1340754

commit_message:
Add three new CLI tests of sahara

This patch adds test cases for sahara CLI Positional arguments:
1. bash-completion
2. help

This patch adds test cases for sahara CLI Optional arguments:
1. version

Partially implements: blueprint cli-tests-coverage

Change-Id: I59c7dd34cdb625eba370aa2a02c7cd25f713fcc0

commit_message:
Add diskimage-buidler to requirements.txt

To enable testing of stable branches, we'll be depending on versioned installs
of DIB during devstack installs.  This adds it to requirements.txt.

Change-Id: Ied149000a0738ddd87ebdc6839a60c3da6a5ffbe

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-15 20:40:28.000000000', 'message': "Don't try to install if packages is empty

After running through pkg-map we could have no packages to install,
if so, don't attempt to run a malformed command.

Change-Id: I4df2108e56d601786ed60c7217a279ac165d58ad
"}]
commit_message:
Don't try to install if packages is empty

After running through pkg-map we could have no packages to install,
if so, don't attempt to run a malformed command.

Change-Id: I4df2108e56d601786ed60c7217a279ac165d58ad

Mark,

See my in-line followup questions regarding the loop.

The test code removed was two workarounds for the issues resolved in this patch, and most of this was REVISIT comments describing why the workarounds were needed. The modified/added code is already covered in existing unit tests.

A good chunk of the added code is 3 or 4 places where I added the semaphore (1 line of code, 4 lines of comments) around with_lockmode('update') transactions.

-Bob"}, {'account_id': 7787, 'date': '2014-04-01 23:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-03-25 23:40:54.000000000', 'message': 'ML2: Bind ports outside transactions

This is currently a work-in-progress. Cleanup is needed, and locking
ml2_port_binding table records for update (with semaphore) is needed.

The ML2 plugin calls the bind_port() operation on the registered
mechanism drivers in order to establish a binding for a neutron port
(i.e. determining the binding:vif_type and what network segment is
being used). It previously made these calls from within a DB
transaction. This was fine for mechanism drivers such as those for the
L2 agents that base their binding decision solely on information from
the neutron DB. But mechanism drivers for controllers or devices need
to make remote calls to determine if binding is possible, and should
not do this from within a DB transaction. Therefore, the bind_port()
calls are now made by the plugin outside of any enclosing DB
transaction. Ports are created or updated in one transaction, then a
binding is established if possible, and then a 2nd transation commits
the binding result.

With [re]binding moved outside the DB transaction that triggered it,
its now possibile that multiple threads or processes will concurrently
try to bind the same port, or that the port will be updated
asynchronously between transactions. Since concurrent access to the
port is unlikely, the strategy is to allow concurrent attempts to bind
the same port, and resolve which results are used in the transaction
after the binding attempt.

Closes-Bug: 1276391
Change-Id: I65dafc330d6e812dad0667d2383858504d0ba299

commit_message:
ML2: Bind ports outside transactions

The ML2 plugin now calls the bind_port() operation on the registered
mechanism drivers outside of any enclosing DB transaction. Ports are
created or updated in one transaction, then a binding is established
if possible, and finally a second transaction commits the binding
result.

With [re]binding moved outside the DB transaction that triggered it,
it is now possible that multiple threads or processes will
concurrently try to bind the same port, or that the port will be
updated between transactions. Concurrent attempts to bind the same
port are allowed to proceed, which results are used is resolved in the
second transaction, and binding is retried if necessary.

Improvements to the Cisco Nexus driver and unit tests from Rich Curran
needed due to the binding changes are also included.

Closes-Bug: 1276391
Closes-Bug: 1335226
Change-Id: I65dafc330d6e812dad0667d2383858504d0ba299

This patch allows us to put a single field called "capabilities" into the .stats property of the host_state which nova's ComputeCapabilitiesFilter uses.  However, in order to have any kind of flexibility there we would like to be able to add arbitrary k/v pairs to host_state.stats.

I propose a small change to PS3 to have properties/capabilities:foo=bar represented as {foo:bar} in the stats dict.  Will upload a new PS on top of this one within an hour or two.'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2014-07-11 15:39:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
